Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
🌈 WE AT FRIENDSURANCE




We believe that dealing with insurance should bring a smile to your face. We build the most intuitive B2B2C SaaS platform, making insurance all about the customer.

As a deeply engaged and capable Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d), you thrive on shaping a strong data culture and building insights-driven solutions that empower those around you.

You act as a key interface between business and data, translating complex information into clear, impactful decisions. In this role, you’ll engage in cross-functional collaboration, reporting, and the development of data products while contributing to strategic company initiatives.




✅ YOUR TASKS & RESPONSIBILITIES




Shape and define the information goals of the business and stakeholders.
Deliver the right reports, analyses, and data solutions using the most suitable tools and technologies for each task.
Identify and integrate useful data sources, collaborating with Data Engineers and stakeholders to build sustainable, end-to-end analytics solutions.
Co-own and evolve data models and business data structures to ensure consistency, scalability, and alignment with business needs.
Lead and support legacy data migrations, ensuring data integrity, efficiency, and seamless integration into modern systems.
Optimize and improve the analytics tech stack, continuously enhancing data processes and tooling.
Work closely with stakeholders to refine requirements and improve how data-driven priorities are set.
Shape the company's Data Strategy alongside the data team and company leadership.
Champion and contribute to a strong data culture across the organization.
Provide expert guidance and support, helping stakeholders obtain the insights they need to make decisions and track success.




🎯 YOU WILL CREATE IMPACT BY




Providing reliable and coherent business data to stakeholders in management and large B2B partners
Creating continuously improving self-service analytics solutions
Building up our data-models and domain-understanding across all company functions
Shape and deliver strategic projects around Data that create direct value




By the way - You don’t need to check all the boxes. We want to meet YOU!




👻 YOUR PROFILE




5+ years of experience in business intelligence and data analytics, delivering insights and reports that drive decision-making.
Proven track record of building insightful reports and conducting in-depth analysis using established reporting tools, preferably Tableau.
Strong SQL expertise with relational databases, especially PostgreSQL, as well as ANSI SQL/Snowflake. Bonus points for query optimization, big-data querying, and columnar storage experience.
Ability to architect and structure reporting and analytics frameworks in a systematic, reusable, and scalable way.
Excellent communication skills, enabling you to effectively convey insights to stakeholders and collaborate with technical and non-technical team members.
Experience with and affinity for Domain-Driven Design (DDD), and other data modeling fundamentals.
Self-sufficient in adopting new technologies and integrating diverse data sources, continuously expanding your analytics capabilities.
Knowledge of common third-party data sources and analytical tools, such as Google Analytics.
Bonus points for experience in adjacent fields like Data Science and Data Engineering (especially Python but also MATLAB, R, Machine Learning, MapReduce, etc.).
A highly professional, curious, proactive, and supportive mindset, driving collaboration and innovation.
Experience working successfully with colleagues from diverse cultural backgrounds.
Fluent in English (C1 or higher) is a must; German is a plus.




🫂 WE AS A TEAM




We are a tight-knit group in a founder-owned “grown-up” startup. We love what we do and what we build and we care about our amazing team. We value each team member and develop their unique talents.




At Friendsurance, we believe that today's social structures disproportionately disadvantage people from marginalized populations - including people of color, people with disabilities, working-class people, single parents, women, and members of LGBTQIA+ communities. We also believe that these groups need to be actively included in the workforce. Therefore, we strongly encourage people with these identities or members of other marginalized communities to apply. We do not require a photo or information about your gender/sex or marital status for our application process.




🤝 OUR OFFER




100% Remote in Germany, on-site in Berlin, or a mix as you wish
Flexible and family-friendly working hours
A big and lovely designed office in Berlin-Kreuzberg with quiet working conditions, plenty of meeting rooms, and your typical startup amenities
A generous personal development budget for all employees
Legendary team events and parties
Language classes
Urban Sports membership subsidy
Unlimited mental health support through OpenUp
A unique and international team
A people-focused management
And much more!




Sounds interesting? We are very much looking forward to your application ❤️

Show more

  • A unique and international team

Title: Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Overview

170+ Years Strong. Industry Leader. Global Impact. At Pinkerton, the mission is to protect our clients. To do this, we provide enterprise risk management services and programs specifically designed for each client. Pinkerton employees are one of our most important assets and critical to the delivery of world-class solutions. Bonded together, we share a commitment to integrity, vigilance, and excellence.

Pinkerton is an inclusive employer who seeks candidates with diverse backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives to join our family of industry subject matter experts.

The Intelligence Analyst, assigned to one of Pinkerton’s largest global clients, will develop high-quality and timely analysis on developments, events, incidents, and trends that may impact the safety and/or security of the customer’s corporate assets in the region including civil unrest, crime, environmental hazards, and terrorism. This position's preferred location is Berlin but London and Paris may be considered.

Responsibilities


Represent Pinkerton’s core values of integrity, vigilance, and excellence.
Monitor, detect, analyze, and advise the client on regional adverse conditions, including civil unrest, crime, environmental hazards, and terrorism.
Plan, research, and write regular analytical reports delivering actionable insights and provide high-quality and value-driven results.
Actively monitor regional security incidents to determine potential impact and maintain an awareness of regional strategic trends.
Collect, analyze, and interpret complex data with a strong understanding and application of analytical techniques.
Conduct strategic analysis on large data sets, including metrics, physical security trends, aggregate incidents, and crime statistics.
Identify gaps in current analysis products and develop new solutions, methodologies, and products to help improve reporting, especially in data-driven analysis.
Support business continuity, crisis, and security management teams during incidents and crises.
Support colleagues if needed, including conducting peer reviews.
All other duties, as assigned.


Qualifications

Master's degree or higher with five years of professional intelligence experience in relevant sector including government and/or law enforcement.


Bi-lingual skills; English and secondary language.
Able to produce strategic intelligence reports, threat assessments, and tailored analysis.
Effective understanding of principal geopolitical risks and how they affect the private sector.
Attentive to detail and accuracy.
Able to carry out responsibilities with little supervision.
Able to collect, organize, and analyze complex data with a strong understanding and application of analytical techniques.
Serve as an effective team member.
Able to develop strong relationships within a complex environment and across multiple time zones.
Able to manage multiple projects simultaneously with competing priorities and deadlines.
Computer skills; Microsoft Office.


Working Conditions

With or without reasonable accommodation, requires the physical and mental capacity to effectively perform all essential functions;


Regular computer usage.
Occasional reaching and lifting of small objects and operating office equipment.
Frequent sitting.
May be required to occassionally work after hours.
Travel, as required.


Pinkerton is an equal opportunity employer to all applicants and positions without regard to race/ethnicity, color, national origin, ancestry, sex/gender, gender identity/expression, sexual orientation, marital/prenatal status, pregnancy/childbirth or related conditions, religion, creed, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or any protected status by local, state, federal or country-specific law.
Show more

Title: Data Science Analyst (w/m/d)
Description:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

Billie's Analytics team is at the heart of the company supporting multiple functions to make data-driven decisions. Analytics team works closely with all Product segments, and other departments by innovating, hypothesizing, strategizing and providing recommended actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams, Customer support and Marketing) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

We are looking for a diligent Data Science Analyst to join Billie's Analytics team and contribute to the development and enhancement of Billie's analytical capabilities.

In this role, you will have the chance to make a significant impact by leveraging data and analytics tools, will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide business decisions within the company values and expectations, and contribute to the ongoing growth of our portfolio.

The ideal candidate is a self-starter, enjoys exploring data for insights to support strategic decision making, is passionate about building data structures, analyzing and reporting on key performance indicators, comfortable working on operational matters, willing to develop expertise in fraud and credit risk prevention, has excellent communication and strong interpersonal skills, and is able to document effectively.

This is a unique opportunity for analysts who are eager to immerse themselves in the heart of fintech business, develop additional skills, and grow within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, apply creative problem-solving skills, and drive business growth through data-driven strategies.

You Will


Perform analysis to develop a deep understanding of the product, and its usage, business processes, and to support business and research hypotheses, including A/B testing of product ideas, identifying new product and business opportunities
Support product segments in creating effective tracking and measurement plans to ensure the impact of new features align with our product strategy
Design data models as part of data solution to support reporting and analysis needs
Create, maintain and update dashboards and reports using BI tools to communicate insights effectively
Enhance data processes, identify gaps, and streamline data collection
Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding Billie's portfolio
Use statistics and ML concepts in developing actionable business solutions
Perform comprehensive data analysis and EDA to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
Communicate and present recommendations and key insights to stakeholders and executives to drive business decisions and create an impact
Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners


Who We Are Looking For


3-5+ years of proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative analytics
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
Proficiency in advanced data and analytics and statistical concepts, tools, and methodologies
Prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar
Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
Ability to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
Strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
Experience working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Strong sense of responsibility, self-motivation, organizational skills, planning abilities, capacity to work independently and meet deadlines
Experience with Python, R and other advanced analytical tools
Previous experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage


What We Offer


Challenging and impactful work that drives personal and professional growth
One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
A hybrid working approach that allows you to work from home for up to 3 days per week
Enjoy 30 days vacation per year on top of paid public holidays, sabbatical opportunities, and extra child sickness leave for parents
Our “Catch a Ride with Billie” program that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG), Deutschland-Ticket, OR JobRad
A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
Free German group classes
An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 40 nationalities represented
Building meaningful connections with your colleagues through company and team events, interest groups, game nights, and more, powered by our Formula Fun Team!


Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.

Please Note

Our policy includes a 180-day waiting period before reconsidering candidates for the same role. This ensures a fair and thorough evaluation of all applicants. If you apply within this cool-off period, your application will be automatically rejected.

Thank you for your understanding.
Show more

  • Collect, consolidate, and closely track KPI metrics regarding Billie's portfolio
  • Use statistics and ML concepts in developing actionable business solutions
  • Perform comprehensive data analysis and EDA to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
  • Communicate and present recommendations and key insights to stakeholders and executives to drive business decisions and create an impact
  • Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners

Who We Are Looking For

  • 3-5+ years of proven experience in data analytics, data engineering or quantitative analytics
  • Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
  • Proficiency in advanced data and analytics and statistical concepts, tools, and methodologies
  • Prior experience building intuitive data visualizations and dashboards that influence business decisions, utilizing tools like Looker, Tableau, Mixpanel, or similar
  • Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
  • Ability to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
  • Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
  • Strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
  • Experience working in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
  • Strong sense of responsibility, self-motivation, organizational skills, planning abilities, capacity to work independently and meet deadlines
  • Experience with Python, R and other advanced analytical tools
  • Previous experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage

What We Offer

  • Challenging and impactful work that drives personal and professional growth
  • One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
  • Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
  • A hybrid working approach that allows you to work from home for up to 3 days per week
  • Enjoy 30 days vacation per year on top of paid public holidays, sabbatical opportunities, and extra child sickness leave for parents
  • Our “Catch a Ride with Billie” program that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG), Deutschland-Ticket, OR JobRad
  • A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
  • Free German group classes
  • An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 40 nationalities represented
  • Building meaningful connections with your colleagues through company and team events, interest groups, game nights, and more, powered by our Formula Fun Team!

Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.

Please Note

Our policy includes a 180-day waiting period before reconsidering candidates for the same role. This ensures a fair and thorough evaluation of all applicants. If you apply within this cool-off period, your application will be automatically rejected.

Thank you for your understanding.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Product Analytics
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team Mission

The Analytics department's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement and take pride in the insights we generate.

As a Data Analyst in the Product Analytics team, you will help drive measurement, strategy, and tactical decision-making within GetYourGuide. You will solve problems that could range from understanding the relationship between review rating and conversion rate, figuring out how to measure adding videos to our product pages, what is the business value of an account login or developing a way to measure whether our customers’ on trip experience is optimal.

Responsibilities


Develop quantitative analysis to drive product decisions.
Help the Search and Discovery group to learn about their features by designing and analyzing experiments.
Design and implement data models, metrics and dashboards to guide the teams’ product strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven product development and evaluation.
Answer the big questions to push our knowledge of our customers further.
Contribute to the strategic thinking of the team by being a thought partner to the Product Manager.


Requirements


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Excellent stakeholder management skills.
Strong knowledge of SQL and knowledge of Python
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Curiosity, reasoning skills with proven evidence of problem solving.
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Ability to navigate ambiguity.
Strong customer focus with a focus on business impact.
Great communication skills


Nice To Have


Previous experience working with agile product teams is a plus.
Previous experience managing analysts is a plus.
Experienced with the statistics and assumptions of experimentation.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus.
Experience with LLM APIs (OpenAI, Gemini, Anthropic) is a plus.


We Offer


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences.
The opportunity to contribute to the
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
Well-stocked kitchen and team-building events
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons


And more…

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Senior Insights Solutions Partner
Description:
About Pinterest

Millions of people around the world come to our platform to find creative ideas, dream about new possibilities and plan for memories that will last a lifetime. At Pinterest, we’re on a mission to bring everyone the inspiration to create a life they love, and that starts with the people behind the product.

Discover a career where you ignite innovation for millions, transform passion into growth opportunities, celebrate each other’s unique experiences and embrace the flexibility to do your best work. Creating a career you love? It’s Possible.

As a Senior Insights Solutions Partner, you will be responsible for understanding business priorities and developing content that contribute to Sales-led revenue and/or deepen strategic advertiser partnerships through custom insights analysis. Working closely with the Sales team to identify the most significant questions posed by advertisers that can be addressed through data and research, you will ideate and execute insights research projects leveraging internal behavioral data analysis, qualitative/quantitative studies, and syndicated research integration. You will distill findings to actionable recommendations and compelling insights stories.

What You’ll Do


Translate data into compelling, actionable narratives that factor in unique stakeholder input and business questions
Design and execute the querying and analysis of first-party platform data to make recommendations that impact German CPG and Emerging sector (non-Retail and non-CPG) advertisers’ business objectives on Pinterest
As a complement to first-party analysis and storytelling, leverage third-party syndicated data sources (comScore, GlobalWebIndex, Mintel) to find and provide wider context. In some instances, partner with research agencies to commission custom research.
Work as a contributing member with Insights Solutions colleagues to tell holistic and compelling stories around a wide range of business opportunities on Pinterest
Lead technical and operational projects and initiatives to improve the impact of the entire International Insights team. Collaborate with peers and stakeholders across multiple functions to achieve business objectives
Manage effective working relationships with internal clients across multiple functions, including sales, marketing and creative teams. Acting not only as an analyst but as a business partner to key internal stakeholders



What We’re Looking For


7+ years of relevant experience using data to solve business challenges and data storytelling to craft engaging and actionable insights designed to influence others
4+ years of experience in data querying and manipulation in SQL is a must
Ability to connect data analysis to real business questions/objectives in order to impact business decisions
Experience contributing to research and insights planning, with an ability to translate business needs into prioritised deliverables, balancing multiple business needs and stakeholders
Experience building presentations in Google Slides; demonstrated interest in data visualization is a plus
Strong communication skills and the ability to use data storytelling to craft engaging and actionable insights for a variety of professional audiences
Track record of operating independently, demonstrating data-backed storytelling skills, being detail-oriented, and delivering results in a highly organized yet engaging manner
Experience in the digital space required; social media, or advertising industry a plus
Experience working quickly and efficiently in a fast-paced tech environment
Excellent relationship-building skills, and a strong ability to work cross-functionally as well as independently
Experience in the CPG or non-Retail sector, within an analytical or advertising function, is a plus
Experience with executing or commissioning quantitative research is a plus
Experience leading programs or initiatives within their team or company is a plus
An understanding of and passion for Pinterest
Bachelor’s/Master’s degree in a relevant field or equivalent experience



Relocation Statement:


This position is not eligible for relocation assistance. Visit our PinFlex page to learn more about our working model.



In-Office Requirement Statement


We let the type of work you do guide the collaboration style. That means we're not always working in an office, but we continue to gather for key moments of collaboration and connection.
This role will expected in the office for in-person collaboration 1 times per week and therefore needs to be in a commutable distance from the German office



Our Commitment To Inclusion

Pinterest is an equal opportunity employer and makes employment decisions on the basis of merit. We want to have the best qualified people in every job. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion or religious creed, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, gender expression, age, marital status, status as a protected veteran, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information or characteristics (or those of a family member) or any other consideration made unlawful by applicable federal, state or local laws. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with legal requirements. If you require a medical or religious accommodation during the job application process, please complete this form for support.

Title: Analytics Team Lead (all genders)
Description:
What To Expect

Caspar Health is the digital rehabilitation clinic with the vision of giving every patient access to the most effective rehabilitation treatment anywhere at any time. We provide individual, digital therapy combined with personal therapeutic care from healthcare professionals. This is your opportunity to help shape traditional healthcare concepts in the areas of prevention and rehabilitation so that people receive the best possible care during and after their clinic stay, regardless of their location.

We're looking for an experienced Analytics Team Lead (all genders) to guide and empower our team of Data Analysts at Caspar. In this role, you'll blend hands-on analytical work with leadership responsibilities, providing insights and driving initiatives that directly impact our business strategy through both your team and your personal contributions. You will be instrumental in leading and mentoring the team, cultivating a collaborative environment, and ensuring the delivery of high-quality, actionable analytics that drive business decisions

Your Challenges

You Will Be


leading, mentoring and developing a team of four data analysts, fostering a culture of continuous learning and growth
providing context and guidance to both your team and to external stakeholders, so that projects can be executed seamlessly
leveraging data insights to proactively identify and drive cross-functional initiatives aimed at improving business outcomes
conceptualizing and evaluating new data architectures, structures and their relationships for complex analysis.
maintaining and improving automation and pipelines design
communicating with key stakeholders to develop dashboards and analysis that can be used to make business-critical decisions.
providing quality assurance of data, working with various departments to ensure accuracy and consistency.


Your profile


You bring at least 2 years of experience as a hands-on Team Lead Data Analyst or in a related role
You love to proactively find problems to tackle and propose solutions for them
You recognize the importance of making sure your team members are happy and have space and time to develop
You have experience / education in the area of data analysis or a degree in a related field (informatics, maths, science etc.)
You are a strong analytical thinker and problem solver
You have a high attention to detail
You can work independently
You are a strong team player and enjoy working in a team
You are a motivated and fast learner
You have strong communication skills


You Have Profound Knowledge Of And Practical Experience In


SQL (Snowflake Preferred)
Data visualisation (Tableau preferred)


Ideally, You Also Already Gained Experience With


The German healthcare sector
German as a language (the working language would still be English)
ELT/ETL processes (DBT preferred)
predictive modelling
A/B testing
product analytics
Python
Git
ML and Data Science


Why Caspar Health?


Looking for commitment? Perfect match! We offer a permanent employment contract.
You don't want to just be a number? Understandable. With us, the human-being is the focus. Every Casparian* can participate in diversity and inclusion initiatives and thus actively contribute to our work culture.
You appreciate feedback? We're happy to hear that. We encourage an open feedback culture to learn and grow together.
You value a good work-life balance? So do we, and that's why we offer flexible working hours, mobile working, also outside of Germany, and various models for part-time work.
You want to develop yourself continuously? With an individual plan and bi-annual development talks we pursue your next career steps together.
You value your health? So do we! We offer weekly, varied sports sessions that are also streamed to your home office. Plus, as a Casparian*, you can take advantage of our health app with mental health-, exercise -, and nutrition modules for free.
Of course, we also offer fresh fruit and a variety of healthy snacks and drinks in our beautiful office in the heart of Berlin.


Diversity And Inclusion

At Caspar Health, we strive to provide a friendly, safe and welcoming environment for all Casparians* regardless of ethnic origin, gender, gender identity and expression, sexual orientation, limitations of any kind, physical appearance, social background, age or religion (or lack thereof).

When you apply, we purely focus on your experience and motivation. You decide what additional information you want to disclose (picture, marital status, religion, gender, nationality, etc). We value and treat all applications equally.

We are looking forward to getting to know you!

Your contact

Dana Kussatz; Talent Acquisition Specialist & HR Business Partner

Please submit your application online. We are also interested in knowing your earliest possible start date and your salary expectations. If you have further questions please reach out to talent@caspar-health.com. We will get in touch with you as soon as we can.

Our product CASPAR Health is used in the environment of medical institutions, patients, doctors and therapists. Working with (sensitive) personal data (e.g. health data) is part of our daily work. Therefore, we require a high level of commitment to the protection of personal data from our employees in order to protect the rights of the data subjects as best as possible.

Note On Data Protection

Please apply exclusively via our career site, as this is the only way we can guarantee the protection of your data. You can find our privacy policy here.

About Us

Caspar Health is a digital rehabilitation clinic with a vision to provide patients with access to the most effective rehabilitation treatment at any time, any place.

Medical facilities use Caspar Health to conduct therapy measures online with their patients during their hospital stay and after discharge. The combination of learning technology with in-depth medical knowledge ensures that the therapy goal is achieved in a sustainable manner.

The services are covered by numerous pension insurance companies in the areas of rehabilitation, prevention and aftercare.

Title: BI-Consultant (m/w/d) - Remote oder Berlin
Description:
Business Intelligence, Corporate Performance und Data Management sowie Controlling und Finanzen: Bei diesen sehr daten- und zahlen­getriebenen Herausforderungen unterstützen wir bei der xax mit einem über 70-köpfigen Team an 5 Standorten deutschlandweit Unternehmen mit der Digitalisierung ihrer individuellen Reporting-, Analyse- und Planungs­prozesse. Von der passenden Tool-Auswahl und der Anforderungsaufnahme über die erfolgreiche Implementierung ihrer individuellen Lösung auf Basis professioneller Software-Werkzeuge bis hin zu Schulungen, Coachings und laufendem Projekt-Support erhalten unsere Kunden seit über 20 Jahren bei uns alles aus einer Hand.




Zur Verstärkung unseres Berliner Teams suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen BI-Consultant - gern auch zu 100% remote, in Voll- oder Teilzeit.




Was wir Dir bieten:




Spannende, anspruchsvolle und abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben mit viel Gestaltungsfreiraum und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten, wie bspw.:

Eigenständige Gestaltung von kundenspezifischen BI-Lösungen (Reporting, Planung) unter Einsatz unterschiedlicher BI-Software (u.a. Infor, Board, Jedox, MS Power BI).
Erstellung individueller ETL-Prozesse, relationaler Data Warehouse-Architekturen sowie multidimensionaler Datenbanklösungen unter Nutzung leistungsfähiger BI-Werkzeuge (u.a. DataVault Builder, MS SSIS).
Direkte Kundenkommunikation, fachliche und technische Anforderungsaufnahme und Beratung.
Die Möglichkeit, Deine Stärken und Ideen individuell einzubringen und zu verwirklichen, um Dich dadurch weiter zu entwickeln.
Ein Team mit starkem Zusammenhalt, das Dir für Fragen und Unterstützung zur Verfügung steht.
Vom ersten Tag an eine Kommunikation auf Augenhöhe mit jedem Teammitglied.
Schnelle Entscheidungsprozesse mit viel Platz für neue Ideen.
Flexible und angenehme Arbeitsbedingungen, wie z.B. Home-Office / Remote-Möglichkeiten.




Was Du mitbringst:




Ausgeprägte Dienstleistungsorientierung und hohe Zuverlässigkeit.
Du verfügst über eine abgeschlossene IT-nahe Ausbildung (z. B. als Kaufmann/-frau für IT-System-Management) oder ein Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik – alternativ bringst du eine vergleichbare Qualifikation für diese Position mit.
Erste Erfahrung im Customizing gängiger BI-Systeme (wie z.B. MS Power BI, Infor, Qlik, Board, Jedox o.ä.)
Grundlegendes betriebswirtschaftliches Verständnis sowie erste Erfahrungen im Projektmanagement.
Tatendrang, Eigeninitiative sowie Spaß an neuen Herausforderungen.
Die Fähigkeit, im Team als auch Kunden gegenüber offen, zielgerichtet und lösungsorientiert zu kommunizieren.
Den Anspruch, Dein Wissen stets zu erweitern, Neues zu lernen sowie Dich und Deinen Erfolg selbstbestimmt zu organisieren.
Großes Interesse an regelmäßigem Feedback.
Verantwortlicher Umgang mit Vertrauensarbeitszeit.
Authentisches Auftreten sowie viele Ecken und Kanten.
Ein sehr gutes Ausdrucksvermögen in der deutschen Sprache.




Interesse?




Wir freuen uns über Deine Bewerbung (im PDF-Format) unter Angabe Deines frühesten Eintrittstermins.

Show more
HTML:
Business Intelligence, Corporate Performance und Data Management sowie Controlling und Finanzen: Bei diesen sehr daten- und zahlen­getriebenen Herausforderungen unterstützen wir bei der xax mit einem über 70-köpfigen Team an 5 Standorten deutschlandweit Unternehmen mit der Digitalisierung ihrer individuellen Reporting-, Analyse- und Planungs­prozesse. Von der passenden Tool-Auswahl und der Anforderungsaufnahme über die erfolgreiche Implementierung ihrer individuellen Lösung auf Basis professioneller Software-Werkzeuge bis hin zu Schulungen, Coachings und laufendem Projekt-Support erhalten unsere Kunden seit über 20 Jahren bei uns alles aus einer Hand.


Zur Verstärkung unseres Berliner Teams suchen wir zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt einen BI-Consultant - gern auch zu 100% remote, in Voll- oder Teilzeit.


Was wir Dir bieten:


Spannende, anspruchsvolle und abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben mit viel Gestaltungsfreiraum und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten, wie bspw.:

  • Eigenständige Gestaltung von kundenspezifischen BI-Lösungen (Reporting, Planung) unter Einsatz unterschiedlicher BI-Software (u.a. Infor, Board, Jedox, MS Power BI).
  • Erstellung individueller ETL-Prozesse, relationaler Data Warehouse-Architekturen sowie multidimensionaler Datenbanklösungen unter Nutzung leistungsfähiger BI-Werkzeuge (u.a. DataVault Builder, MS SSIS).
  • Direkte Kundenkommunikation, fachliche und technische Anforderungsaufnahme und Beratung.
  • Die Möglichkeit, Deine Stärken und Ideen individuell einzubringen und zu verwirklichen, um Dich dadurch weiter zu entwickeln.
  • Ein Team mit starkem Zusammenhalt, das Dir für Fragen und Unterstützung zur Verfügung steht.
  • Vom ersten Tag an eine Kommunikation auf Augenhöhe mit jedem Teammitglied.
  • Schnelle Entscheidungsprozesse mit viel Platz für neue Ideen.
  • Flexible und angenehme Arbeitsbedingungen, wie z.B. Home-Office / Remote-Möglichkeiten.


Was Du mitbringst:


  • Ausgeprägte Dienstleistungsorientierung und hohe Zuverlässigkeit.
  • Du verfügst über eine abgeschlossene IT-nahe Ausbildung (z. B. als Kaufmann/-frau für IT-System-Management) oder ein Studium der (Wirtschafts-)Informatik – alternativ bringst du eine vergleichbare Qualifikation für diese Position mit.
  • Erste Erfahrung im Customizing gängiger BI-Systeme (wie z.B. MS Power BI, Infor, Qlik, Board, Jedox o.ä.)
  • Grundlegendes betriebswirtschaftliches Verständnis sowie erste Erfahrungen im Projektmanagement.
  • Tatendrang, Eigeninitiative sowie Spaß an neuen Herausforderungen.
  • Die Fähigkeit, im Team als auch Kunden gegenüber offen, zielgerichtet und lösungsorientiert zu kommunizieren.
  • Den Anspruch, Dein Wissen stets zu erweitern, Neues zu lernen sowie Dich und Deinen Erfolg selbstbestimmt zu organisieren.
  • Großes Interesse an regelmäßigem Feedback.
  • Verantwortlicher Umgang mit Vertrauensarbeitszeit.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Growth Analytics
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, travelers from over 170 countries have booked more than 200 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 700 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics department's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement and take pride in the insights we generate.

This Organic Growth Analytics team works with marketeers, analysts, product managers, data scientists and engineers to create and promote a best-in-class marketplace product. You will also collaborate closely with the Marketing Analytics team that focuses on paid acquisition channels to create an aligned holistic view. Your team will build an understanding of how to utilise our organic growth channels to the maximum capacity, and support the teams to reach their targets via operational and strategic insights, identifying opportunities and enabling proper measurement.

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to drive product and marketing decisions.
In collaboration with stakeholders identify organic growth opportunities and dependencies.
Collaborate with marketing analytics and Growth cluster leads to develop a comprehensive understanding of user acquisition and retention channels.
Design and implement data models, metrics and dashboards to guide the teams strategy and success.
Support the technical teams in tracking and producing more insightful data.
Contribute to the learning and experimentation culture of the company by promoting hypothesis-driven development and evaluation.
Answer the big questions to push our knowledge of our customers further.
Contribute to the strategic thinking of the team by being a thought partner to the Product Managers and Marketing Leads.


Who You Are


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Excellent stakeholder management
Strong knowledge of SQL and experience with statistical packages (e.g. R, Python)
Strong statistical background and proficiency with advanced statistical methods
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers, and translate them into actionable insights
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction in ambiguous situations and with highly engaged individuals
Strong customer-centric mindset with a focus on business impact
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice To Have


Experience in SEO and CRM analytics, and with growth data products is of significant benefit.
Familiarity with ETL technologies like Airflow is a plus.
Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus.
Experience with LLM APIs (OpenAI, Gemini, Anthropic) is a plus.


How We Set You Up For Success


Meaningful work that helps create memorable travel experiences
A diverse, inclusive environment where your voice is valued
Collaboration with smart, engaged colleagues from over 80 nationalities
English-speaking office environment
Continuous learning opportunities through monthly Hackathons, weekly tech talks, and an annual external training budget
Mentorship programs to support your growth and career development
Flexible working arrangements to support work-life balance
GetYourGuide vouchers and free German lessons
Relocation assistance if needed


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: (Junior) Data Engineer
Description:
Team

The Risk Controlling & Regulatory Reporting is a key function within the company that is responsible for generation of reports for regulatory and risk controlling purposes for Raisin.

To this extent, we build and maintain data pipelines using Snowflake, Looker, Airflow (MWAA) and dbt that process financial data and transform it. We then make these accessible to our regulatory and risk teams, who rely on this data to perform internal audits and report KPIs to regulatory authorities

Your Responsibilities


Work on and orchestrate scalable data pipelines to efficiently process and analyse large volumes of data, utilising Python, Snowflake, Airflow and dbt.
Collaborate with stakeholders to help translate their requirements into technical steps and coordinate the projects you drive with them.
Monitor and improve the health of our data pipelines.
Promote knowledge sharing within the team to foster collaboration and continuous learning
Stay updated on emerging technologies and best practices in data engineering and bring new ideas to enhance the technical set-up.
Maintain our CI/CD pipeline on Harness.


Your Profile


Solid experience with Airflow, Python programming and SQL / dbt.
Experience with cloud data warehouses such as Snowflake is a plus.
Knowledge of AWS services and Docker is a plus.
Bachelors in Mathematics, Computer Science or other relevant quantitative fields
Strong analytical and quantitative approach to problems
Familiarity with Data Engineering best practices, including Data Quality and Observability.
Comfortable working in a dynamic and changing environment, with a strong sense of responsibility.
Eagerness to learn and grow through on-the-job learning.


Join our mission, join our team - and grow with us!

At Raisin, we care about each other and it is one of our top priorities to foster an open and caring environment in which everyone feels welcome and comfortable. Our culture is strongly driven by our ambitious team, which, connects more than 40 different nationalities.

You'll find us in our modern and open office in the trendy Kreuzberg district with a view of the Spree River, ideally connected to public transportation and surrounded by a variety of restaurants and shopping opportunities.

As Part Of Our Team, You Will Benefit From


Employee Development Budget of €2,000 and four full training days per year.
Access to Babbel for continuous language learning.
Hungry all the time? Snacks, daily fresh fruit as well as drinks provided at the office.
Flexible working hours, home office and 28 vacation days.
Enjoy more than 50+ different sports with Urban Sports Club: We subsidize your membership with more than €20 per month.
Love cycling? With JobRad, lease the bike of your choice and enjoy tax savings, plus Raisin covers your monthly insurance costs.
A company pension scheme (Betriebliche Altersvorsorge), which we support with 20%.
Do you miss being in the office? The Deutschland Ticket gets you there, which we subsidize with €25 per month.


About Us

Raisin is the trailblazer in the savings and investment space. Founded in 2012, the fintech company started by opening the $95+ trillion deposits and investments market of the European Union, the United Kingdom and the United States to consumers.

Today, Raisin serves more than one million customers in these three markets, offering savings products as well as investment and pension products. This makes the Berlin-based fintech one of the leading global savings and investments marketplaces. Savers get a wider choice of attractive products with the ability to move their money freely. In addition, financial service providers get best-in-class marketplace solutions for their customers, and banks get better access to retail funding.

Raisin operates its own B2C marketplaces in Europe and the U.S. under the brands Raisin and WeltSparen. In Germany, the company offers ETF-based investment and retirement products in addition to savings products. Raisin works with over 400 banks and financial service providers from over 30 countries

We are backed by renowned international investors such as b2venture, Deutsche Bank, Goldman Sachs, Greycroft, Headline, Index Ventures, Latitude Ventures, Orange Ventures, PayPal Ventures, Top Tier Capital Partners, Ribbit Capital, Vitruvian Partners and M&G.

At Raisin, we care about each other and it is one of our top priorities to foster an open and caring environment in which everyone feels welcome and comfortable. Our culture is strongly driven by our ambitious team, which connects more than 75 different nationalities.

In total, we have 7 offices across the world: Berlin, Frankfurt, Hamburg, Madrid, Manchester, Munich and New York.

We also think it’s important to take the time to celebrate our hard work and achievements together, with events like our yearly summer and winter party, as well as a couple of smaller get-togethers.

We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and German.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







Apply Online Today!

Show more

Title: Staff Product Analyst, Adtech
Description:
About The Opportunity

We are on the lookout for a Staff Product Analyst to join the Adtech tribe on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

We work on developing digital advertising solutions for our vendors. Currently, these solutions are available on our food ordering platform, both on mobile and the web. The Ad Tech solutions support the vendors in all three steps of the marketing funnel: awareness, consideration, and conversion enabling them to achieve sustainable growth on our platform.

A Product Analyst in the Ad Tech organization plays a pivotal role in enabling data-driven decision-making. You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define and implement tracking requirements, set up A/B tests, analyze large datasets to provide actionable insights on the performance of different revenue streams, and communicate the results to relevant stakeholders.

You will be a critical member in defining the product strategy and the continued success of our brands.

If you're a creative problem solver who is hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!


Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions
Develop in-depth analytical understanding for what drives growth for the product and how it can be improved
Leverage insights from data by providing analyses, reports and dashboards for product management and other departments
Use quantitative analysis and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand what drives our business, providing insights to help product managers, designers, and engineers to decide which features to build and why
Work with structured and semi-structured data from different data sources and different products


What you need to be successful


Overall 5+ years of experience, preferably in e-commerce
You've completed a degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, computer science or an equivalent education or possess relevant practical experience
Very good communication skills in English, both written and oral
Data Analysis: Strong experience in SQL (BigQuery) and Python (alternatively R)
A/B Testing: Experience designing experiments and analyzing results with a solid background in statistics
Data Visualization Technologies: Preferably Tableau or similar alternatives e.g. Looker, QlikView, etc.


Nice to have:


Tracking Technologies: Google Analytics or similar alternatives e.g. Adobe Analytics/Omniture, SnowPlow, etc.
Industry expertise in advertising and/or marketing.


Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.


Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.


Ready to join our team? If you’re excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world’s leading delivery platform, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

We are on the lookout for a Staff Product Analyst to join the Adtech tribe on our journey to always deliver amazing experiences.

We work on developing digital advertising solutions for our vendors. Currently, these solutions are available on our food ordering platform, both on mobile and the web. The Ad Tech solutions support the vendors in all three steps of the marketing funnel: awareness, consideration, and conversion enabling them to achieve sustainable growth on our platform.

A Product Analyst in the Ad Tech organization plays a pivotal role in enabling data-driven decision-making. You will have end-to-end ownership of data: define and implement tracking requirements, set up A/B tests, analyze large datasets to provide actionable insights on the performance of different revenue streams, and communicate the results to relevant stakeholders.

You will be a critical member in defining the product strategy and the continued success of our brands.

If you're a creative problem solver who is hungry for a new adventure, an international workplace is waiting for you in the heart of Berlin!

  • Drive data mindset in the team, guide in terms of methodology, support and execute testing, and be a quality gatekeeper on data leading to product decisions
  • Develop in-depth analytical understanding for what drives growth for the product and how it can be improved
  • Leverage insights from data by providing analyses, reports and dashboards for product management and other departments
  • Use quantitative analysis and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand what drives our business, providing insights to help product managers, designers, and engineers to decide which features to build and why
  • Work with structured and semi-structured data from different data sources and different products

What you need to be successful

  • Overall 5+ years of experience, preferably in e-commerce
  • You've completed a degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, computer science or an equivalent education or possess relevant practical experience
  • Very good communication skills in English, both written and oral
  • Data Analysis: Strong experience in SQL (BigQuery) and Python (alternatively R)
  • A/B Testing: Experience designing experiments and analyzing results with a solid background in statistics
  • Data Visualization Technologies: Preferably Tableau or similar alternatives e.g. Looker, QlikView, etc.

Nice to have:

  • Tracking Technologies: Google Analytics or similar alternatives e.g. Adobe Analytics/Omniture, SnowPlow, etc.
  • Industry expertise in advertising and/or marketing.

Who we are

As the world’s pioneering local delivery platform, our mission is to deliver an amazing experience, fast, easy, and to your door. We operate in over 70+ countries worldwide, powered by tech, designed by people. As one of Europe’s largest tech platforms, headquartered in Berlin, Germany. Delivery Hero has been listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange since 2017 and is part of the MDAX stock market index. We enable creative minds to deliver solutions that create impact within our ecosystem. We move fast, take action and adapt. No matter where you're from or what you believe in, we build, we deliver, we lead. We are Delivery Hero.

What's in it for you

Ensuring you and all our Heroes are looked after, happy, and healthy is always on the menu. Because if you’re in good shape, then we’re in good shape.

  • Make the most of our hybrid working model and join the team for face-to-face connection and collaboration in our beautiful Berlin campus 2 days a week
  • We offer 27 days holiday with an extra day on 2nd and 3rd year of service
  • We will support you in developing yourself and your career growth opportunities: 1.000 € Educational Budget, Language Courses, Parental Support and access to the Udemy Business platform to explore a variety of online courses.
  • Get moving and release those wonderful, mind-boosting endorphins: Health Checkups, Meditation, Yoga, Gym & Bicycle Subsidy
  • Cash. Dough. Cheddar. Whatever you call it, we’ll help you with it: Employee Share Purchase Plan, Sabbatical Bank, Public Transportation Ticket Discount, Life & Accident Insurance, Corporate Pension Plan
  • The power of getting together over some food is unrivaled. Here are a few ways to help you do that. All the yum: Digital Meal Vouchers, Food Vouchers, Corporate Discounts. Courses.

Ready to join our team? If you’re excited to grow, collaborate and be part of the world’s leading delivery platform, we’d love to hear from you. Apply today!

We believe diversity and inclusion are key to creating not only an exciting product, but also an amazing customer and employee experience. Fostering this starts with hiring - therefore we do not discriminate on the basis of racial identities, religious beliefs, color, national origin, gender identities or expressions, sexual orientations, age, marital or disability statuses, or any other aspect that makes you, you. We encourage you to let us know if you need any accommodations or specific accessibility support to ensure a smooth interview experience—just include it in your application. You're welcome to share your pronouns (he/she/they) right from the start so we can address you respectfully from our first contact.

Title: Business Data Analyst – Reporting & Automation (w/m/d)
Description:
Unternehmensbeschreibung

Mit Enpal verfolgen wir den Traum, die größte Erneuerbaren-Community Europas zu bauen. Wie wir das schaffen? Enpal macht Solar endlich einfach: Wir vermieten Solaranlagen, Stromspeicher und Wallboxen zum All-inclusive-Tarif, ergänzt um einen günstigen Ökostromtarif, und intelligent vernetzt zu einer integrierten Gesamtlösung. Ganz nach dem Motto „digital, dezentral und zu 100% erneuerbar“, schlägt unser Herz dabei sowohl für den rasanten Aufbau eines Unternehmens als auch für die Bekämpfung der größten Herausforderung unserer Generation – Der Klimawandel.

Unser hochambitioniertes Team rund um Serienunternehmer Mario Kohle wird unterstützt von erfahrenen Investoren wie Alexander Samwer (Picus Capital) und Lukasz Gadowski (Team Europe, Delivery Hero). Darüber hinaus konnten wir Princeville Climate Technology (beraten und finanziert u.a. durch Leonardo DiCaprio) und Peter Rive (SolarCity) on board holen. Als erstes grünes Unicorn in Deutschland sehen wir unsere Pflicht darin, unsere Mission von grüner Energie für alle weiter voranzutreiben. Sei auch Du Teil dieser Erfolgsgeschichte und verändere mit uns gemeinsam die Welt!

Stellenbeschreibung


Mitwirkung am Aufbau und der Weiterentwicklung einer der führenden Asset-Management-Organisationen für erneuerbare Energien in Europa.
Gestaltung und Optimierung von Performance-Reportings für das Management.
Durchführung umfassender und themenübergreifender Analysen (Excel / SQL) zur Überwachung der aktuellen Performance sowie zur Identifikation von Verbesserungspotenzialen.
Verantwortung für Projekte innerhalb der Asset-Management-Organisation – mit Freiraum für eigene Ideen und Lösungen.
Möglichkeit, Prozesse aktiv mitzugestalten und zur Weiterentwicklung des Unternehmens beizutragen.
Enge Zusammenarbeit innerhalb des Asset Managements sowie cross-funktional über Abteilungsgrenzen hinweg.



Qualifikationen


Studium in Wirtschaftswissenschaften, Statistik, Mathematik, Data Analytics oder einem vergleichbaren Bereich.
Erfahrung im Umgang mit SQL, Excel und Automatisierungstools (z. B. Python und Power Automate).
Fähigkeit, komplexe Daten zu analysieren und verständlich aufzubereiten.
Kenntnisse in Datenvisualisierungstools wie Tableau oder Power BI.
Kommunikationsstärke sowie sicheres Auftreten gegenüber Stakeholdern.
Fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse.



Zusätzliche Informationen


Arbeite in Deutschlands erstem grünen Unicorn und gestalte aktiv die solare Energiewende mit.
Die Sonne scheint auf der ganzen Welt - Bei Enpal findest du ein hochmotiviertes und diverses Team, mit mehr als 65 verschiedenen Nationalitäten.
Lieber dem Haustier daheim oder den Kolleg:innen im Büro Gesellschaft leisten? Auch nach der Pandemie bieten wir dir ein hybrides Arbeitsmodell.
Wir erfüllen jedes Startup-Klischee - In unserem modernen Office in Berlin-Friedrichshain findest du von Tischtennisplatte und Yoga-Ecke bis Dachterrasse und gefüllten Getränkekühlschränken alles was das Herz begehrt.
Dein Kick-start bei Enpal - Lerne an deinem Onboarding-Tag das Unternehmen, deine Teamkolleg:innen und unseren Gründer Mario kennen.
Bleib auf dem Laufenden - Egal ob Unternehmenszahlen bei unseren monatlichen All-Hands-Meetings oder die Funktionsweise einer Photovoltaikanlage beim Lunch & Learn, du weißt immer genau Bescheid.
Energiewende geht nur gemeinsam - Bei Enpal erwartet dich ein legendärer Teamspirit und unvergessliche Teamevents.
Ohne Fehler kein Fortschritt - Wir leben eine starke Feedback-Kultur und wachsen mit deinem Input.



Wir bei Enpal sind stolz auf die Vielfältigkeit unseres Teams. Weder bei der Einstellung noch während des Beschäftigungsverhältnisses werden Entscheidungen auf Basis von Hautfarbe, Religion oder religiösen Glaubens, ethnischer oder nationaler Herkunft, Nationalität, Geschlechteridentität, sexuelle Orientierung, Behinderung oder Alter getroffen. Enpal steht für einen sicheren Arbeitsplatz und geht gegen Diskriminierung und Belästigung jeglicher Art vor.

Title: Junior Research Analyst
Description:
Job Title

Junior Research Analyst

Job Description Summary

Cushman & Wakefield (NYSE: CWK) is a leading global commercial real estate services firm for property owners and occupiers with approximately 52,000 employees in nearly 400 offices and 60 countries. In 2024, the firm reported revenue of $9.4 billion across its core service lines of Services, Leasing, Capital markets, and Valuation and other. Built around the belief that Better never settles, the firm receives numerous industry and business accolades for its award-winning culture. For additional information, visit www.cushmanwakefield.com.

Job Description

The Junior Research Analyst, Germany supports research, data & analytics and reporting activities across the German market. This junior role is designed to assist with the organic growth of the German businesses by thought leadership and insight outputs to help generate leads and business opportunities.

The role will report to the Head of Research, Germany, working within established frameworks to ensure consistency of client experience, processes and operational excellence across the EMEA region. The role will also collaborate with colleagues from local business services departments, as well as other central functions, mainly Marketing and Data & Analytics teams.

Key Responsibilities


Assist with real estate data collection and contribute to the update of existing databases (office, industrial, retail, residential, hotel, investment etc.) to support regular market and economic updates.
Cooperate with other business services teams to gather and organize local and regional market insights, including competitive, client, and industry data.
Provide support for business development activities, including preparing materials for market updates to clients.
Conduct market analyses for ad-hoc reports for clients as defined by the business and senior team members.
Assist with marketing and communication activities in line with the company content strategy defined by the Head of Business Development Services, Germany.
Begin contributing to C&W brand visibility through participation in public events and social media with guidance from senior team members.
Support cooperation efforts with C&W research teams in other countries and the wider EMEA team.


Interests, Knowledge And Experience


Interests :
Curiosity and interest in real estate, urban development, economic interrelations and data
Analytical skills:
Fundamental data collection and market research skills
Ability to organize data, identify trends, and visualize results
Attention to detail and capability to verify information under guidance
Communications skills:
Good knowledge of both German and English languages required (written and verbal)
Ability to present data in clear formats through reports, presentations, and basic data visualizations with guidance
Problem solving:
Working effectively within a team structure and learning to collaborate cross-functionally with internal teams in a deadline-driven environment
Ability to learn quickly and solve problems creatively
Interest in learning about key real estate metrics
Tools used:
Working knowledge of MS Office (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, OneDrive, SharePoint) with advanced skills in Excel (enthusiasm for working with Excel and data manipulation is highly desirable)
Interest in learning: MS Power BI, Power Query, GIS software (ArcGIS, QGIS)
Entry-level experience or internship in professional services or the real estate sector preferred
Degree in Economics, Geography, Real Estate, related fields or other fields with a focus on quantitative research preferred.

What We Offer

Early assumption of responsibility, flat hierarchies and an international and modern working environment, flexible working hours with the possibility of hybrid work scheme, 30 vacation days plus special leave days, further training and development opportunities, company pension scheme and Deutschlandticket.

We foster a culture of inclusion that embraces the unique strengths, perspectives, and experiences of all our employees. We firmly believe that our diversity enhances our team's capabilities, leading to improved decision-making, innovation, and business outcomes.

INCO: “Cushman & Wakefield”

Datenanalyse, Optimierung und Reporting mittels Power-BI und Excel
Datenaufbereitung, Extraktion, Transformation und Modellierung von Daten aus verschiedensten Quellen
Entwicklung von automatisierten Datenanalyen und Berichten zur Effizienzsteigerung
Zusammenarbeit mit anderen Fachbereichen zur Definition von KPIs und Reports
Kontinuierliche Optimierung der Datenqualität und -verfügbarkeit


Ihr Profil


Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium im Bereich Ingenieurwesen, Betriebswirtschaftslehre, Controlling, IT-Bereich oder Wirtschaftsingenieurwesen wünschenswert
Mehrjährige Erfahrung im Bereich Datenanalyse wünschenswert

strukturiertes und konzeptionelles Arbeiten
Selbstständigkeit, Eigeninitiative, sowie Kommunikations- und Durchsetzungsfähigkeit
Sehr sicherer Umgang mit IT- und KI-Anwendungen

vielseitiges Tätigkeitsfeld in einem kollegialen Team
diverse Benefits wie Betriebliche Altervorsorge mit Arbeitgeberzuschuss, Mitarbeiterevents, Gesundheitsprämie uvm.

voestalpine Turnout Technology Germany GmbH, Tochter des weltweitführenden Anbieters von Systemlösungen für die Bahninfrastruktur, voestalpine Railway Systems, ist Spezialist im Bereich Weichenbau. Das Unternehmen produziert mit 1.000 Mitarbeitenden an drei Standorten in Deutschland (Brandenburg, Butzbach und Gotha) Weichen und Weichenkomponenten für die Bereiche Hochgeschwindigkeit, Mischverkehr, Nahverkehr sowie Industrie- und Hafenbahnen. Die voestalpine Turnout Technology Germany ist international führender Entwickler modernster Weichentechnologie und sichert ihren Kund:innen innovative, zuverlässige und langlebige Produkte zu besten Lebenszykluskosten.
