Title: Data Analyst Co-op
Description:
Data Analyst Co-op

Statut

Horaire, Temps partiel

Emplacement

Concord, Ontario

Description Du Poste

Reporting to the VP of the Region, the Data Specialist (Co-op) shall maintain and ensure integrity of all information received from central branches in order to achieve cohesiveness between the new ERP system and the previous system in place, and further support after conversions have completed. As a Co-op Data Analyst with a focus on SPA (Special Pricing Agreement) rebates, you will play a crucial role in optimizing our pricing strategies and ensuring accurate and efficient rebate management. You will have the opportunity to work with a diverse team of professionals, gain hands-on experience in data analysis, and contribute to our company's success.


Price lists
Product information
Customer and Manufacturer Files


Responsibilities


Work closely with the Managers to gather and enter the proper information for their corresponding branches in the new ERP system
Communicate with the P21 team to ensure cohesiveness in information
Lead managers on proper organization of data groups and files
Price list validation through internal procedures
Build price matrixes using spreadsheet when necessary
Communicate with team to gather missing information
Perform macros and Excel advanced formulas for price management
Be comfortable with flexibility of tasks and responsibilities
Collect, clean, and analyze data related to SPA rebates.
Identify trends and patterns in rebate data to inform pricing strategies.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure accurate rebate calculations.
Develop and maintain data dashboards and reports for SPA rebate tracking.
Assist in the automation of rebate processes to improve efficiency.
Support ad-hoc data analysis projects as needed.


Qualifications


Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Data Science, Business Analytics, Finance, Economics, Computer Science).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (e.g., Excel, Python, SQL)
Attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks.
Previous experience with SPA rebates or pricing analysis is a plus.


Pourquoi se joindre à nous?

On est un acteur majeur, engagé dans la transformation énergétique au Canada. Certifié Great Place to Work®, on offre un environnement de travail convivial, de l’autonomie et du pouvoir décisionnel.

On Se Distingue Par Notre 


Partage annuel des profits offert à tous qui s’ajoute à notre rémunération concurrentielle : récompenser les victoires fait partie de notre culture.
Solide réseau national permettant de réelles possibilités de grandir: nos gens font la différence.


Parmi Nos Avantages


Programme d’assurances collectives flexible et complet qui s’adaptent aux besoins de chacun.
Ressources santé disponibles 24/7: télémédecine et programme d’aide aux employés (PAE).
REER collectif avec contribution de l’employeur et CELI.
Programme de bourses d’études postsecondaires pour les enfants.
Lieux de travail munis de bornes de recharge.
Programme de reconnaissance des années de service.


Joins la grande famille Guillevin : un groupe en plein essor. Viens faire la différence et y faire carrière.

Notre processus de recrutement assure l’égalité et la diversité. Prends note que seuls les candidats retenus seront contactés.

HTML:
Data Analyst Co-op

Statut

Horaire, Temps partiel

Emplacement

Concord, Ontario

Description Du Poste

Reporting to the VP of the Region, the Data Specialist (Co-op) shall maintain and ensure integrity of all information received from central branches in order to achieve cohesiveness between the new ERP system and the previous system in place, and further support after conversions have completed. As a Co-op Data Analyst with a focus on SPA (Special Pricing Agreement) rebates, you will play a crucial role in optimizing our pricing strategies and ensuring accurate and efficient rebate management. You will have the opportunity to work with a diverse team of professionals, gain hands-on experience in data analysis, and contribute to our company's success.

  • Price lists
  • Product information
  • Customer and Manufacturer Files

Responsibilities

  • Work closely with the Managers to gather and enter the proper information for their corresponding branches in the new ERP system
  • Communicate with the P21 team to ensure cohesiveness in information
  • Lead managers on proper organization of data groups and files
  • Price list validation through internal procedures
  • Build price matrixes using spreadsheet when necessary
  • Communicate with team to gather missing information
  • Perform macros and Excel advanced formulas for price management
  • Be comfortable with flexibility of tasks and responsibilities
  • Collect, clean, and analyze data related to SPA rebates.
  • Identify trends and patterns in rebate data to inform pricing strategies.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure accurate rebate calculations.
  • Develop and maintain data dashboards and reports for SPA rebate tracking.
  • Assist in the automation of rebate processes to improve efficiency.
  • Support ad-hoc data analysis projects as needed.

Qualifications

  • Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in a relevant field (e.g., Data Science, Business Analytics, Finance, Economics, Computer Science).
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
  • Proficiency in data analysis tools and programming languages (e.g., Excel, Python, SQL)
  • Attention to detail and a commitment to data accuracy.
  • Excellent communication and teamwork skills.
  • Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks.
  • Previous experience with SPA rebates or pricing analysis is a plus.

Pourquoi se joindre à nous?

On est un acteur majeur, engagé dans la transformation énergétique au Canada. Certifié Great Place to Work®, on offre un environnement de travail convivial, de l’autonomie et du pouvoir décisionnel.

On Se Distingue Par Notre

Parmi Nos Avantages

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description & Requirements

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.

We evolve our games and how players interact with them by using the power of data to continuously uncover insights to deliver an even better player experience. We strive to be the best-in-class AI team in the gaming industry by maximizing the fun for EA players through easier deployment of AI-driven solutions for game makers. Our insights are ubiquitous through autonomous analytics.

The Data and Analytics (DnA) team is looking for a Data Analyst to work either hybrid or remote from Vancouver, BC. The Data Analyst will focus on improving data capabilities and business intelligence for our Quality verification teams, astute at spotting patterns, identifying risk and opportunity and convey complex concepts, using game data to improve our Game Development and Quality Verification strategies.

You will report to the Analytics Manager.


You will define the data analytics roadmap for some of EA's largest titles.
You will use your technical skills to develop data products that improve decision-making across the Quality Verification organization.
You will guide best practices in tools and visual technologies to help evolve the project dashboards to provide essential data for project monitoring.
You will develop scripts and queries to import and manipulate data from multiple sources.
You will help us promote a data-driven culture and support data governance practices to improve our organization's data maturity.


The Next Great Data Analyst Needs


2+ years of professional analytical experience, using data to improve processes.
Programming and Database experience with advanced SQL experience and efficient in Python.
Knowledge of different data software analytics and visualization tools such as Looker and PowerBI.
Able to develop data modelling and warehousing solutions.
Able to plan and prioritize multiple concurrent projects.
Able to foster working relationships with partners.


Compensation And Benefits

The ranges listed below are what EA in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in these locations at the time of this posting. If you reside in a different location, a recruiter will advise on the applicable range and benefits. Pay offered will be determined based on a number of relevant business and candidate factors (e.g. education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, or business needs).

PAY RANGES


British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria) * $73,200 - $101,700 CAD


In British Columbia, we offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.

About Electronic Arts

We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.

We take a holistic approach with our benefits program, focusing on physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life with paid time off and new parent leave, plus free games and so much more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
LayerZero

The Future is Omnichain.

Founded in 2021, LayerZero’s vision is to create a community of cross-chain developers, building dApps that are no longer constrained by individual blockchain capabilities. With LayerZero's simple, generic messaging protocol, builders will develop cross-chain dApps designed to unify the power of individual blockchains.

We are funded by the best investors in the world including:

a16z, Sequoia, PayPal, Binance Ventures, Coinbase Ventures, Uniswap Labs, Circle Ventures, Delphi Digital, and many more.

About The Role

As we continue to grow at LayerZero, we're faced with an exciting set of challenges: more data, more developers, more teams, more projects, and more opportunities for innovation. To tackle these problems head-on, we're expanding our data team with a dedicated Data Analyst.

As a Data Analyst at LayerZero, you'll be at the forefront of shaping a rich data foundation for a company that's making a real impact in the web3 space. You'll work closely with teams and leaders to uncover insights, drive decision-making, and fuel our next-generation products and services.

What You’ll Do

As a key member of the data team at LayerZero, you'll be diving headfirst into the world of crypto data - exploring on-chain wallets and contracts, block and transaction data, insights from in-house systems, and third-party intelligence. Your mission will be to combine these diverse datasets into rich, actionable data products for a broad group of stakeholders.


Leveraging and expanding our ever-growing Kimball dimensional model.
Writing SQL to create and expand insights in our in-house reporting solutions.
Collaborating with stakeholders across the organization to conduct ad-hoc explorations and analytics - from engineering questions to help understand production issues to product insights that illuminate the broader crypto landscape.
Be a key owner of data quality, building out insights that serve the data team itself to help guide our data efforts towards cleaner and richer data.
Compose pipelines by writing SQL code to clean, combine, refine, and aggregate data into the insights the organization needs.
Collaborating on new datasets to ingest into our Snowflake data warehouse, working closely with data engineers on your team.
Not afraid of pushing code that supports tens of billions of dollars in daily transaction volume.


About You

We are looking for someone with previous data analyst experience. Likely with a bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Physics or related field, but we also consider and highly value equivalent practical experience.

Required


Strong SQL knowledge and experience
Proven track record in data modeling, statistics, and analytics
Experience working with a broad range of stakeholders
Strong convictions weakly held.
You enjoy working in a fast-paced start-up environment, where you'll need to take initiative and solve problems independently.
You understand the importance of data quality through incremental data development.


Bonus


Experience with general programming, we use Python and Go on the data stack
Experience with Snowflake
Experience building DAG based data pipelines
Experience with streaming real-time data pipelines
Previous experience with blockchain technologies, smart contracts, and decentralized finance
Experience with Kimball dimensional modeling
Working on a mid-to-large scale data stacks


Equal Opportunity Employer

LayerZero Labs is committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace. LayerZero Labs is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, protected veteran status, disability, age, or any other legally protected status.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position Information

Title Data Analyst Job Status Regular Full Time Position Overview

The City of North Vancouver is the urban core of the beautiful North Shore and has a long-term vision to be “The Healthiest Small City in the World”, with five key priorities to be a City for People, a Resilient City, a Vibrant City, a Connected City and a Prosperous City.

The Information Technology department requires a highly driven and innovative Data Analyst to support data initiatives that enhance decision-making and operational effectiveness across municipal services. This role will play a key part in shaping the City’s data strategy by developing and implementing business intelligence solutions, ensuring data integrity, and promoting a data-driven culture. The ideal candidate will leverage their expertise in data wrangling, analytics, and visualization to support strategic priorities and drive innovation within municipal operations.

Responsibilities

Reporting to the Manager of Data Services, you will research, identify, and compile datasets from diverse sources to support business needs. You will develop and implement ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) workflows to validate, process, and integrate structured data, leveraging statistical analysis, data modeling techniques, and business intelligence tools to uncover key patterns, trends, and anomalies. Additionally, you will design and develop interactive dashboards, reports, and data visualizations that effectively communicate performance metrics and insights to stakeholders, enabling data-driven decision-making.

Collaboration with cross-functional teams will be essential to understand data requirements and maintain data accuracy, consistency, and integrity. As a subject matter expert in data analytics, you will provide guidance on best practices for data management and analytics while actively exploring emerging technologies in data science to recommend innovative tools that enhance the City’s data analytics and reporting capabilities.

Requirements

Proficiency in SQL and relational databases, particularly SQL Server, is essential, along with experience in ETL processes and building data pipelines to process and integrate structured data. Strong Python skills for data manipulation, analysis, and automation are important, complemented by a solid foundation in statistical analysis and data modeling techniques.

Expertise in SSRS and Power BI—including DAX and Power BI Service administration—is essential for developing and sharing insightful reports, dashboards, and visualizations that support data-driven decision-making. Strong communication skills are crucial for translating complex data into clear, actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders. Familiarity with spatial data, ArcGIS applications within a municipal setting is also a significant asset.

The ideal candidate will have a Bachelor’s degree in computer science, mathematics, statistics, data science, or a related field, plus sound related experience in quantitative data analytics, business intelligence, and data modeling. An equivalent combination of education, training, and experience will also be considered.

Compensation

$46.07 to $54.44 per hour (January 2024 rates)

Pay Grade 26 (Provisional)

Hours of Work

The City of North Vancouver currently works on a compressed work schedule of 8:30 am to 5:00 pm, Monday to Friday, with one scheduled day off (Monday or Friday) approximately every three-week scheduling cycle.

Additional Information How To Apply

If you are passionate about making the City of North Vancouver an even greater place to live, work and play, apply on-line through the Career Portal at www.cnv.org by April 30, 2025.

We respectfully acknowledge that we live and work on the traditional and unceded territories of the Sḵwx̱ wú7mesh Úxwumixw (Squamish Nation) and səlilwətaɬ (Tsleil-Waututh Nation). The City of North Vancouver is committed to Reconciliation with these Nations, who have lived on these lands since time immemorial.

Posting Detail Information

Posting Number 2025-0045 Job Open Date 04/16/2025 Job Close Date 04/30/2025 Special Instructions to Applicants
Show more

Title: Advanced Data Analyst, UGX
Description:
Description & Requirements

Electronic Arts creates next-level entertainment experiences that inspire players and fans around the world. Here, everyone is part of the story. Part of a community that connects across the globe. A place where creativity thrives, new perspectives are invited, and ideas matter. A team where everyone makes play happen.

We are looking for a dedicated Advanced Data Analyst to join our UGX and Player Safety team. Reporting to the Senior Manager of Analytics, you will play an important part in meeting the increasing demand for data-driven insights that shape our decision-making processes. Working within an exciting and cross-functional environment, you will collaborate with several teams to deepen engagement and improve retention of our players.

You will foster relationships and collaborate with several data professionals across the organization and be challenged by complex data systems. Your responsibilities may span diverse projects across UGX, with a focus on improving the UGC search experience through advanced analytics.

Hybrid or remote work available. Preferably in Vancouver but open to all of Canada.

Responsibilities


Partner with Product Managers to analyze the impact of products and solutions within the game and provide applicable recommendations to affect future iterations.
Craft KPIs to guide the success strategy for user generated content search experience in game.
Analyze performance and effect of ML models on player experience to influence data scientists on future iterations.
Profile, clean and analyze data through SQL, R/Python and other database technologies.
Identify data quality issues, assess downstream impact and propose practical solutions.
Partner with data engineers, architects and QV to develop ETLs and stored procedures.


Qualifications


A degree in a quantitative discipline (Statistics, Data Science, Business, Mathematics, Economics)
5+ years of experience doing complex quantitative analysis to help guide decisions, in a consumer products-oriented industry (e.g. gaming, entertainment, e-commerce)
Advanced knowledge in SQL and relational databases with proficiency analyzing large datasets in programmatic analysis tools (e.g. Python, R)
Advanced in dashboard development (i.e. Looker, Tableau, PowerBI)
Experienced with experimental design and applied statistics
Practical experience with statistical models
Direct experience working with user generated content or search solutions preferred


Compensation And Benefits

The ranges listed below are what EA in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in these locations at the time of this posting. If you reside in a different location, a recruiter will advise on the applicable range and benefits. Pay offered will be determined based on a number of relevant business and candidate factors (e.g. education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, or business needs).

PAY RANGES


British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria) * $107,600 - $147,100 CAD


In British Columbia, we offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.

About Electronic Arts

We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.

We take a holistic approach with our benefits program, focusing on physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life with paid time off and new parent leave, plus free games and so much more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

  • 5+ years of experience doing complex quantitative analysis to help guide decisions, in a consumer products-oriented industry (e.g. gaming, entertainment, e-commerce)
  • Advanced knowledge in SQL and relational databases with proficiency analyzing large datasets in programmatic analysis tools (e.g. Python, R)
  • Advanced in dashboard development (i.e. Looker, Tableau, PowerBI)
  • Experienced with experimental design and applied statistics
  • Practical experience with statistical models
  • Direct experience working with user generated content or search solutions preferred

Compensation And Benefits

The ranges listed below are what EA in good faith expects to pay applicants for this role in these locations at the time of this posting. If you reside in a different location, a recruiter will advise on the applicable range and benefits. Pay offered will be determined based on a number of relevant business and candidate factors (e.g. education, qualifications, certifications, experience, skills, geographic location, or business needs).

PAY RANGES

  • British Columbia (depending on location e.g. Vancouver vs. Victoria) * $107,600 - $147,100 CAD

In British Columbia, we offer a package of benefits including vacation (3 weeks per year to start), 10 days per year of sick time, paid top-up to EI/QPIP benefits up to 100% of base salary when you welcome a new child (12 weeks for maternity, and 4 weeks for parental/adoption leave), extended health/dental/vision coverage, life insurance, disability insurance, retirement plan to regular full-time employees. Certain roles may also be eligible for bonus and equity.

About Electronic Arts

We’re proud to have an extensive portfolio of games and experiences, locations around the world, and opportunities across EA. We value adaptability, resilience, creativity, and curiosity. From leadership that brings out your potential, to creating space for learning and experimenting, we empower you to do great work and pursue opportunities for growth.

We take a holistic approach with our benefits program, focusing on physical, emotional, financial, career, and community wellness to support a balanced life with paid time off and new parent leave, plus free games and so much more. We nurture environments where our teams can always bring their best to what they do.

Electronic Arts is an equal opportunity employer. All employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, national origin, ancestry, sex, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, age, genetic information, religion, disability, medical condition, pregnancy, marital status, family status, veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We will also consider employment qualified applicants with criminal records in accordance with applicable law. EA also makes workplace accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities as required by applicable law.

Title: Data Analyst, Operations and HSSE
Description:
POSITION DESCRIPTION – DATA ANALYST, OPERATIONS & HSSE




POSITION OVERVIEW

Reports to: Head of Operational Analytics

Location: Vancouver




POSITION SUMMARY




The Data Analyst, Operations and HSSE (Health, Safety, Sustainability and Environment) plays a critical role in supporting health and safety, sustainability, and operational reporting across a global portfolio at Eldorado Gold. This position is responsible for collecting, analyzing, and visualizing data to drive informed decision-making and continuous improvement in site performance. The analyst ensures the timely and accurate consolidation of daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual reports, integrating data from multiple sites and operational systems. The Analyst will collaborate with site teams and corporate functions to enhance operational and HSSE data generation, validation, tracking and reporting.




KEY RESPONSIBILITIES




Data Visualization & Business Intelligence

Design and maintain interactive dashboards and reports using Power BI or similar tools to enhance decision-making and planning.
Integrate operational software insights into dashboards to improve operational visibility and forecasting.
Create clear, user-friendly data visualizations to communicate complex operational, health & safety, and sustainability trends.
Continuously enhance data visualization techniques to improve data accessibility insights for sites and corporate teams.




Operational Performance & Reporting




Support the completion and maintain updated key operational and HSSE data processes mapping.
Consolidate operational data from multiple mine sites for daily, weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual performance reports.
Utilize AVEVA and Pi data historian to collect, process, and analyze real-time mining and processing data.
Automate reporting processes to enhance data accuracy, efficiency, and transparency across sites.
Work closely with operations and technical services teams to improve data collection, standardization, and reporting methodologies.
Provide ad hoc analysis on production, mining and processing efficiency, energy usage, and other key performance areas.
Support the broader Operational Support and Technical Services team on data related projects including such activities as daily and monthly operational reports, business planning, production forecasting and continuous improvement projects.
Support quality assurance and quality control activities to ensure the integrity of the data being collected and analyzed.




Health & Safety and Sustainability Reporting




Collect and validate health, safety and sustainability data from various sources to provide consolidated reporting.
Support the implementation of our global HSSE data platform.
Act as a “super user” of our global HSSE data platform to support sites implementation.
Maintain in-depth knowledge of our global HSSE data platform and oversee the integrity, accuracy and security of the data within the platform.
Identify and implement improvements to data management processes within HSSE.
Monitor key health, safety, and environmental KPIs, identifying trends and providing actionable insights to site teams and corporate leadership.
Support incident tracking, risk analysis, and environmental compliance reporting, leveraging automation where possible.




VALUES

Collaboration – We succeed together
Integrity – We are honest and do the right thing
Agility – We continuously assess, adapt and navigate to find solutions
Courage – We embrace the unknown and face challenges head-on
Drive – We persevere through adversity, remaining committed to delivering on our promises




QUALIFICATIONS, KNOWLEDGE & PREVIOUS EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS




Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Business Intelligence, Mining Engineering, Environmental Science, or a related field.
5+ years of general industry experience preferably in mining, natural resources, or heavy industries and 3+ years of experience in a data analysis, reporting, or business intelligence role.
Strong proficiency in Excel, SQL, Power BI, Tableau, and other data visualization tools.
Experience using AVEVA and Pi data historians for real-time operational data collection and analysis is strongly preferred
Understanding of mining operations, processing plants, etc. is a strong asset.
Knowledge of Extract, Transform, Load (ETL) processes, automation tools, and database management is an advantage.
Ability to work with large, complex datasets while ensuring data integrity and compliance with industry standards.
Strong communication and stakeholder engagement skills, with the ability to present technical data to non-technical audiences.
Collaborative team player with the ability to work effectively across departments and locations.
International travel to project sites and regional offices required up to 10–15% of the time, as needed.

Title: Insights Analyst
Description:
Senior Insights Analyst, Fit Excellence

12-month Contract with opportunity to extend

Hybrid(4 onsite days per week)

Vancouver, B.C.




About the team

The Product Insight team is the intersection of product design and supply chain technology for our top retail client. This group has a strong focus on data and analytics with a goal to improve product sustainability and customer experience. This group gives leadership insight to further create incredible products and experiences for their customers world wide.




Day in the Life

Supports end to end strategy and delivery for lululemon's Product Voice of Guest program specific to guest fit/sizing capturing feedback across all internal and external channels and creating valuable insights to inform all areas of the business
Produce executive-level reporting gleaning insights and telling a compelling post-launch product story through data that fits the audience
Conduct research and performs various analyses to drive data-driven insights for Fit Excellence
Bring analytics/BI best practices for reporting and data infrastructure for Global Quality
Provide input to Fit and Sizing stakeholders in process improvement sessions around analyzing guest insights through quantitative, qualitative, and statistical methods, including but not limited to defining the tools or engineering solutions needed to improve reporting efficiency and effectiveness




Qualifications:

5+ years expert level in telling a compelling story with powerful insights based on analyzed large quantities of qualitative and quantitative data
10+ years of data analytics, data modelling, and reporting, preferable in a retail or supply chain environment
Expert-level proficiency in Excel, Power BI, SQL, database management, data modeling, and database structures; experience with Smartsheet and SSRS/PBI Report Builder
Excellent communication, spelling and grammatical attention to detail both written and verbal with external and internal stakeholders across all levels










Eight Eleven Group (Brooksource) provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, citizenship, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, amnesty, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws.

Title: Data & Analytics - Senior Data Analyst
Description:
TEAM

The mission of the Data & Analytics Department is to provide the business with actionable and accurate information to enable data-driven decision-making.




THE OPPORTUNITY

Aritzia is growing and our Data & Analytics team is growing with it. This is a unique opportunity to be part of the team responsible for bridging the gap between business strategy and data. As a Sr. Data Analyst, Supply Chain, you will combine your deep understanding of who our clients are with your passion for data and masterful analytics skills to uncover opportunities that will enable Aritzia to create long lasting relationships with clients. With the skills you gain in this role, the opportunities are endless – from a rewarding career in Analytics to continued growth and development with Aritzia.




THE ROLE

As the Senior Data Analyst, you will:

Seek to deeply understand Aritzia’s supply chain practice and generate actionable insights by analyzing operational warehouse data
Understand and transform complex business problems into data & analytics requirements
Partner closely with business leaders and cross-functional partners to enable data-driven decisions that will enable efficiencies, enhance customer experience and grow the business
Leverage advanced analytics to build, influence and refine models that enable data driven insights, predict outcomes and recommend actions
Visualize and communicate data through reports, dashboards and presentations
Assess day-to-day business performance, proactively investigate trends searching for root cause and recommend actions when appropriate




THE QUALIFICATIONS

The Senior Data Analyst has proven skills, certifications, and / or experience with:

SQL and large datasets
Analyzing data with Excel
Visualizing data and building dashboards with tools like Tableau, Looker or Power BI
Python or R for data analysis
AI / ML models
Supply Chain, warehouse management or logistics subject areas as an added benefit




THE COMPENSATION

The typical hiring range for this position is $100,000 - $150,000 CAD per year. The final agreed upon salary may vary based on factors such as job-related knowledge, skills and experience. Additionally, this position may be eligible for bonus.




We are always looking for top talent - if your qualifications differ from those listed above, the scope of work and final agreed upon [salary/wage] may be adjusted to reflect your individual qualifications.




Aritzia’s Everyday Luxury compensation package goes beyond the base salary with endless growth and recognition opportunities through our pay-for-performance philosophy. Along with comprehensive benefits, aspirational workspaces and elevated employee perks and experiences - we provide it all.




THE PERKS

Some of the industry-leading benefits you will receive working at Aritzia:

Product Discount – Maybe you’ve heard of our famous product discount? Or our exclusive private shopping events? You have now.
A-OK Commissary & Café – Everyday Luxury dining, exclusive to Aritzia. Our in-house bistro and café is a private oasis where employees can enjoy curated, subsidized Everyday Luxury dining.
The SET – Our in-office fitness studio and gym with state-of-the-art equipment, custom-created classes, and optional personal training. Open 7 days a week, works out well.
Aritzia Virtual Wellness – Because your health, happiness, and safety matter – 24/7 resources to support you in your wellbeing goals, be it physical, mental, social, or financial.
Aspirational Workplace – Our offices are specially designed to be spaces of creativity, productivity, and inspiration. They’re also dog friendly. Woof.
Amenities – Additional amenities include a private parent’s room, shower facilities with elevated complementary conveniences, bike rooms, and more.
The Extras – We also offer a multitude of other perks like dry-cleaning, hotel and restaurant discounts, self-care promos and on-site medical care.
Flexible Working Arrangement – This role is based out of our Aritzia Distribution Center in New Westminster, with some flexibility to work from home and at our head office in Vancouver.




ARITZIA




Aritzia is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Our goal is to be inclusive, diverse, and representative of the communities where we work while creating an environment where every person can enjoy a successful career. This commitment applies to all candidates and employees regardless of race, ethnicity, citizenship, creed, place of origin, religion, sex, gender identity, gender expression, sexual orientation, family status, marital status, disability, age, and any other protected characteristic.




Requests for accommodation due to a disability or any other protected characteristic can be made at any stage of the recruitment process and during employment by contacting our People & Culture Team.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
As a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst, you will develop dashboards, reports, and visualizations to support business decision-making. Your day will involve working closely with business stakeholders to gather requirements, collaborating with data engineers to integrate and transform data, and ensuring BI tools deliver accurate and actionable insights. You will monitor data quality, optimize performance, and contribute to data governance efforts while maintaining documentation and providing training to business users.

💼 A DAY IN THE LIFE


BI Solution Design: Play a key role in designing BI solutions, including dashboards, reports, and visualizations, that meet the strategic and operational needs of the business. Recommend solutions based on best practices, balancing practicality and business value. Raise concerns for unfeasible solutions, and obstacles that prevent solutions from being implemented.
Collaboration (Engineering) Collaborate with data engineers to integrate data from various internal and external sources. Facilitate support from business stakeholders in answering engineering questions.
Collaboration (Business): Work closely with business stakeholders (e.g., product, marketing, finance) to gather requirements, understand business needs, and deliver BI solutions that drive actionable insights.
Dashboard & Report Creation: Develop interactive, user-friendly dashboards and reports using Tableau, ensuring they are tailored to the needs of different business units.
Data Transformation & ETL Processes: Work with the data engineering team to design and implement ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) processes, transforming raw data into clean, structured formats ready for analysis and reporting.
Data Quality Assurance: Monitor and maintain the quality and integrity of BI data, ensuring reports and dashboards are accurate, up-to-date, and meet user requirements. This includes Tableau data environment (Tableau Flow), investigating and preventing stale data in reports.
Data Catalog & Governance: Contribute to and help maintain a data catalog by collaborating with Data Stewards on shared definitions and their consistent application across reporting.
Performance Optimization: Strive for high performance of BI tools and reports, focusing on optimization and ensuring that queries and visualizations are fast and efficient. Identifying bottlenecks where possible for engineering to support.
Documentation & Training: Maintain thorough documentation on BI processes, models, and tools. Provide training to business users to ensure they can make the most of the BI solutions you develop.
Self Development: Stay current with industry trends, new BI tools, and best practices, ensuring that BI solutions evolve to meet changing business needs


🎯 What You Bring To The Table


Experience designing BI solutions that align with business needs while ensuring feasibility and value.
Strong ability to develop interactive dashboards and reports, primarily using Tableau.
Ability to work effectively with data engineers and business stakeholders to translate business needs into BI solutions.
Understanding of data extraction, transformation, and loading (ETL) processes to ensure clean, structured data.
Experience maintaining data accuracy, monitoring Tableau environments, and contributing to a data catalog.
Staying current with industry trends, BI tools, and best practices to improve solutions over time.


💰 Compensation & Benefits


Salary $55,000 to $70,000 per annum (Actual salary offered will be commensurate with education, experience and internal parity).
The Total Compensation Package includes Extended Health, Dental. Focus on your development through our professional development programs. Enjoy a variety of health and wellness initiatives, including access to gym facilities at our corporate head office. Speak to us to learn more about what we offer.


📌 THE HIRING PROCESS


Pre-Screen – Let’s talk about your experience, goals & excitement for this role!
Interviews – Two or more interviews with different team members, including structured competency & scenario-based questions
Presentation/Assessment
References & Background Check
We use audio recording transcription for our interview practices 🔊


🏆 About Us

Did you know O2E Brands has been voted one of the Best Workplaces in Canada 14 times!? Take a sneak peek into why that is, here: (YouTube) Check us out on social! At O2E Brands, we know that great talent comes in many forms, and we want to meet you at your best. We will provide reasonable accommodations to applicants with disabilities at any time throughout the recruitment and selection process. Please contact our Talent Acquisition Team at talentacquisition@o2ebrands.com or notify the Talent Acquisition team member you are working with if unique arrangements will enable your equal participation.

➡️ Ready to take your career to the next level? Apply today! 🚀

Title: Data Centre Analyst
Description:
Marketing Statement

A career at TransLink and our family of companies means working with people with a wide range of skills and perspectives, all teaming up towards a common goal: preserving and enhancing the region's world-envied quality of life. Together, we connect the region and enhance its livability by providing a sustainable transit and transportation network, embraced by our communities and people.

At TransLink we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live. We’re committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace, recognizing the unique value and skills every individual brings.

Looking for a great place to work where your contributions are valued and you can make a difference in a vibrant city? At TransLink, one of BC’s Top Employers, you'll help make Metro Vancouver a better place to live, built on transportation excellence. Put your future in motion!

Summary

Responsibilities

The Data Centre Analyst is responsible for the maintenance and operations of all data centre facilities across the enterprise. Plans, schedules, and executes the daily operational activities for all enterprise facilities, from the Data Centre to communication closets, while adhering to established IT change management policies and procedures. Monitors and maintains the operational aspects of the enterprise backup system. Develops and maintains documentation in support of the operation of the Data Centre. Mitigates operational and system risks in alignment with enterprise risk management and ensures the monitoring and analysis of Data Centre infrastructure statistical data. Plans and schedules the Data Centre infrastructure replacement lifecycle. Develops and refines Data Centre practices to follow accepted best practices.

Duties And Responsibilities

Plans, schedules, and executes the daily operational activities for all enterprise facilities ranging from the Data Centre to communication closets. These activities include, but are not limited to, the following:

Analyzes the ongoing performance of the Data Centre infrastructure including servers, storage and supporting systems to ensure optimal operation,

Assesses system power and cooling requirements at all sites and develop plans to increase the efficiency of those sites through a reduction in the consumption of both power and cooling,

Manages the support call lifecycle with infrastructure vendors in support of both component failures and analysis indicating component performance issues,

Provides expertise in the process of racking of network equipment, servers and storage according to data centre best practices.

Monitors and maintains the operational aspects of the enterprise backup system by:

Analyzes schedule policies and makes adjustments to backup windows as needed relative to the requirements of the business,

Recommends best practices and advancements that support the current IT strategy,

Monitors system health and daily backup jobs, performs on-demand restores of business data and the configuration of agents on computer systems.

Develops and maintains comprehensive documentation in support of the operation of the Data Centre. Documentation includes run books for all infrastructure components describing routine maintenance activities, standard operating procedures and system configurations.

Mitigates Operational And System Risk By

Analyzes operating system patches and system and storage firmware upgrades in support of enterprise risk management,

Plans and scheduling firmware upgrades and operating system patches with input from other BT teams to mitigate identified risks and within the parameters of the enterprise change management process,

Coordinates the testing of infrastructure components in collaboration with other enterprise teams,

Responds to emergency call-outs for immediate operational support as required.

Ensures the monitoring and analysis of Data Centre infrastructure as follows:

Develops infrastructure capacity monitoring programs to provide accurate forecasting and planning information,

Establishes KPIs to provide accurate dashboard information,

Monitors enterprise resource consumption and creates trending analysis for storage and servers,

Tracks power and cooling and summarizes consumption trends for dashboard reporting,

Summarizes status providing monthly dashboard reporting including, but not limited to, power and cooling usage and infrastructure capacities.

Plans and schedules the Data Centre infrastructure replacement lifecycle as follows:

Remains current on technology roadmaps and provides recommendations to the IT Operations management team related to the infrastructure replacement program,

Plans and schedules the introduction of new infrastructure into the Data Centre to review the changing technologies and determine suitability in the enterprise environment,

Prepares the configuration of infrastructure components for the enterprise procurement process,

Ensures assets, including racks, servers, storage, appliances and cabling are accurately recorded in the current asset management system,

Monitors the infrastructure equipment through the current asset management system.

Develops And Refines Data Centre Practices As Follows

Reviews current processes and procedures, identifies limitations, recommends and implements improvements,

Ensures the enterprise remains current on best practices and trends in data centre management,

Creates, reviews and maintains documentation in support of data centre best practices,

Contributes to the development of the Data Centre workplans.

Performs related duties as assigned, such being items of a minor nature that do not affect the value of the job.

Education

Qualifications

Requires a diploma in computer science from a recognized institute of technology specializing in network configuration and administration, and computer hardware systems.

Experience

Requires three (3) years previous experience in an information technology environment involving the installation, maintenance, operations, troubleshooting and support of corporate network and hardware systems, including one (1) year in a Data Centre environment supporting relevant power management, cooling and operation specific systems. A further period of up to one (1) year on the job is required to become thoroughly familiar with the enterprise architecture plan, IS policies and standards, the enterprise Data Centre and specific network and hardware components.

Additional Requirements

Candidate must hold a valid class 5 driver’s license.

Ability to lift and maneuver objects up to 50 lbs.

Other Information

Recruitment Process: An applicant will be required to demonstrate their suitability for this position by meeting the minimum level of qualifications and experience in order to be invited into the selection process. A standard interview format will be used including general, scenario and behavioural descriptive interview questions.

Work Schedule

37.5 hours per week.

Work Designation

Hybrid

This position offers the flexibility of working both on-site and remotely within B.C.

Rate of Pay

Salary $8,236.33 - $9,896.62 per month (Actual salary offered will be commensurate with education, experience and internal parity).

The Total Compensation Package includes Extended Health, Dental, Transit Pass and enrollment in the Public Service Pension Plan. Focus on your development through tuition reimbursement, training, and mentorship programs. Enjoy a variety of health and wellness programs, including access to gym facilities. Speak to us to know more about what we offer.

How To Apply

Please click the 'Apply' button at the top right corner of the page or go to http://www.translink.ca/careers to apply for this position and view instructions on the process.

INSTRUCTIONS: Please save your (1) cover letter, and your (2) resume as one pdf document prior to uploading your application on-line.

Posting Date: April 17, 2025

Closing Date: Open until filled

Please note that only those short listed will be contacted.

Having trouble applying? Please view the System Requirements & FAQ's by going to http://www.translink.ca/careers.

Equal Employment Opportunity

TransLink is committed to employment equity and building a diverse workforce, representative of the customers we serve and the many communities in the Metro Vancouver region. We welcome and encourage Indigenous applicants, people of colour, all genders, 2SLGBTQ+ and persons with disabilities to apply. Learn more about TransLink's commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion.

Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. For a confidential inquiry, simply email us at jobs@translink.ca.

Marketing Statement

A career at TransLink and our family of companies means working with people with a wide range of skills and perspectives, all teaming up towards a common goal: preserving and enhancing the region's world-envied quality of life. Together, we connect the region and enhance its livability by providing a sustainable transit and transportation network, embraced by our communities and people.

At TransLink we are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live. We’re committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace, recognizing the unique value and skills every individual brings.

Looking for a great place to work where your contributions are valued and you can make a difference in a vibrant city? At TransLink, one of BC’s Top Employers, you'll help make Metro Vancouver a better place to live, built on transportation excellence. Put your future in motion!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We're Hiring!

We're looking for brilliant thinkers to join our #Rocketeers. If you've ever wondered what it's like to work in a place where people enjoy their work and where talent is more important than the title, then keep reading.

What is ScalePad?

ScalePad is a market-leading software-as-a-service (SaaS) company with headquarters in Vancouver, Toronto, Montreal and Phoenix, AZ. However, we are proud to say our employee reach is now global so we can best serve our partners all over the world.

Our success is no accident: ScalePad provides MSPs of every size with the knowledge, technology, and community they need to deliver increased client value while navigating the continuously changing terrain of the IT landscape. With a suite of integrated products that automate and standardize MSP’s operations, analyze and uncover new opportunities, and expand value to clients, ScalePad is equipping the MSP adventure.

ScalePad has received awards such as MSP Today’s Product of the Year, G2’s 2024 Fastest Growing Product, and 2024 Best IT Management Product. In 2023, it was named a Best Workplace in Canada by Great Place to Work™. ScalePad is a privately held company serving over 12,000 MSPs across the globe.

You can contribute to our innovation and appreciate how your work is helping take this company to a higher level of operational maturity. More on that here.

Your mission should you choose to accept it.

As a Data Analyst, you will be a strategic partner to ScalePad’s Finance team, transforming complex data into clear, actionable insights. By refining internal processes and enhancing data-driven decision-making, you will help drive financial efficiency, scalability, and automation. Your work will ensure that leadership has the accurate, timely information needed to optimize performance, forecast with confidence, and support the company’s continued growth.

Responsibilities.


Design, develop, and maintain SQL-based data models to ensure efficient data transformation and reporting.
Build and optimize ETL pipelines within BI tools or deliver data through APIs.
Work closely with business stakeholders to understand requirements and translate them into scalable, maintainable analytics solutions.
Develop and manage dbt-based data transformations and Databricks workflows.
Build and enhance dashboards and reports in Tableau, ensuring data is accurate, accessible, and well-structured for analysis.
Collaborate with Data Engineers to improve data architecture, ensuring performance and scalability.
Utilize Python, R, SAS, or equivalent statistical tools for deeper data analysis, modeling, and automation.
Maintain data quality, governance, and documentation across all analytics solutions.


Qualifications.


5+ years of experience in analytics engineering, data analytics, or a related field.
Experience working in a SaaS environment is required.
Expert-level SQL skills with experience optimizing complex queries and data models.
Hands-on experience with ETL pipeline development within BI tools or using APIs.
Proficiency in dbt, Databricks, and Tableau.
Experience working with Python, R, SAS, or similar statistical analysis software.
Strong ability to engage with stakeholders, understand business needs, and develop analytical solutions that drive decision-making.
Experience working in a cloud-based data environment (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP) is a plus.
Excellent communication and problem-solving skills with a consultative approach.


What You’ll Love Working As A Rocketeer:


Everyone’s an Owner: Through our Employee Stock Option Plan (ESOP), each team member has a stake in our success. As we scale, your contributions directly shape our future – and you share in the rewards.
Growth, Longevity and Stability: Benefit from insights and training from our leadership and founder, whose extensive experience in funding and scaling successful software companies creates a stable environment for your long-term career growth. Their proven track record fosters a culture of lasting success.
Annual Training & Development: Every employee receives an annual budget for professional development, empowering you to advance your skills and career on your terms.
Hybrid Flexibility: Enjoy a world-class office at our headquarters in downtown Vancouver, Toronto, and Montreal and Arizona
Cutting-Edge Gear: Whether in the office or at home, you’ll be set up for success with top-of-the-line hardware.
Comprehensive Benefits: We’ve got you covered with an extensive benefits package with 100% medical and dental coverage fully employer-paid.
Flexible Time Off: With our unlimited flex-time policy in addition to all accrued vacation allows you to take the time you need to recharge and thrive.


Dream jobs don’t knock on your door every day.

ScalePad is not your typical software company. When we hire you, we aren’t just offering you a job, but rather we are committing to investing in both you and your long-term career. You'll help shape how this modern SaaS company operates and make a genuine impact on the future of our people, product, and partners.

We invite all qualified candidates to apply. Please note, you must be eligible to work in either Canada or the United States without requiring Visa sponsorship to be considered for this role. We thank you for your interest. However, only successful applicants will be contacted.

At ScalePad, we believe in the power of Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging (DEIB) to drive innovation, collaboration, and success. We are committed to fostering a workplace where every individual's unique experiences and perspectives are valued, and where employees from all backgrounds can thrive. Our dedication to DEIB is woven into the fabric of our culture, guiding our actions and decisions as we build a stronger and more inclusive future together.

Join us and be part of a team that celebrates differences, embraces fairness, and ensures that everyone has an equal opportunity to contribute and grow. Together, we're creating an environment where diverse voices are not only heard but also amplified, where everyone feels valued, and where we can all achieve our full potential.

Please no recruiters or phone calls.

Title: Western Canada Operations Data Analyst
Description:
Position Title: Western Canada Operations Data Analyst

Department: Operations Support

Reports To: Western Canada Manager, Operations Data

Direct Reports: None

Indirect Reports: None

Date: April 2025




Purpose of Position

The Western Canada Operations Data Analyst supports the development and maintenance of operational datasets and reporting tools that drive performance, consistency, and continuous improvement across collection and post-collection programs in Western Canada. This role transforms raw data into actionable insights to inform business decisions across the organization.




Key Responsibilities

Compliance, Metrics & Reporting

Design, build, and maintain Power BI dashboards and reports in collaboration with cross-functional teams, from requirement gathering to publication.
Maintain the “Master Dataset,” ensuring data connectivity, integrity, and accessibility.
Create custom DAX measures and use Power Query to enhance analytical outputs.
Compile and deliver operational scorecards and performance metrics.
Standardize collection and post-collection reporting across jurisdictions using consistent tools and methodologies.
Document and maintain operational procedures, business glossaries, and reporting standards to support end users.
Manage and archive reporting documents related to Recycle BC and SK Recycles programs.
Monitor and evaluate the performance of service providers and third-party partners, ensuring compliance with agreements.
Provide support on pilot projects and technology rollouts, offering guidance and reporting assistance.
Identify and mitigate data-related risks and ensure regulatory and contractual compliance.

Cross-Functional Collaboration & Technology Support

Act as a technical liaison for tools such as Power BI, CRM (C4C), AWS, SAP, and Microsoft Dynamics.
Support team members in utilizing these tools effectively.
Assist with planning and execution of operational projects, including pilots and new initiatives.
Maintain an integrated supply chain perspective linking collection, post-collection, supply, and audit activities.
Advocate for continuous improvement by identifying opportunities to streamline processes and reduce waste.
Support JIRA adoption within the team, including board setup, filters, and dashboards to improve project tracking and collaboration.
Work with IT and project leads to ensure accurate reflection of operational milestones in JIRA.
Ensure alignment and data integrity across the Recycle BC and SK Recycles ecosystems and SAP systems.




Interpersonal & Communication Responsibilities

Internal Collaboration:

Partner closely with the Western Canada Manager, Operations Data to identify data and reporting needs.
Collaborate with internal teams, including Recycle BC and SK Recycles staff, to ensure timely and accurate reporting.

External Collaboration:

Coordinate with external contractors and consultants on project deliverables.
Work cross-functionally with departments including Business Intelligence & Analytics, Data Visualization, Enterprise Knowledge, and Report Development.




Qualifications

Education:

Post-secondary education in IT, analytics, business operations, supply chain, or administration is an asset but not mandatory.

Experience:

Minimum of 2 years of experience in data analytics, with a strong focus on Excel and Power BI.
Experience in process improvement or operations is considered an asset.

Technical Skills:

Proficient in DAX, Power BI, Power Query, and Excel.
Familiarity with CRM systems (C4C), SAP (BW, S4HANA), AWS, and Microsoft Dynamics.
Basic knowledge of JIRA or similar project management tools.
Ability to automate reporting workflows and manage dashboard version control using tools like SharePoint or DevOps.

Soft Skills:

Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Clear communication and interpersonal skills to support collaboration across departments.
Excellent organizational and time-management skills.
Self-motivated and able to work independently.
A mindset focused on continuous improvement and operational excellence.

Working Conditions

Occasional travel within Western Canada may be required; a valid provincial driver’s license is necessary.
Extended hours may be needed during peak periods (e.g., quarterly reporting, business planning).
Must be comfortable working in a dynamic environment with frequent changes.




To apply, please submit your resume to this posting or email it directly to david.litherland@summitsearchgroup.com. Please note only qualified individuals will be contacted.




Summit Search Group is a fair and equitable search firm. We welcome and encourage applications from all candidates regardless of ethnicity, race, religious beliefs, disability, age, gender identity, or sexual orientation. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment and selection process.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
At Raymond James, we develop, we collaborate, we decide, we deliver, and we improve together .

Raymond James Ltd. is Canada’s leading independent investment dealers offering high quality investment products and services to Canadians seeking customized solutions to their wealth management needs.

Senior Data Analyst

How Does The Role Impact The Organization?

We are seeking an experienced Senior Data Analyst. Reporting to the Manager, Reporting and Analytics of the Enterprise Data team the Senior Data Analyst will be responsible for designing and building business intelligence and data integration solutions.

The Senior Data Analyst at Raymond James will help the organization to become more data driven by assisting the business in turning data into information, turning information into insight and insight into decisions. The analyst will conduct full lifecycle activities including requirements analysis, data analysis, data modeling, design, and development of data solutions.

What Will Your Role Be Responsible For?


Interpret business and data requirements after eliciting the problem that needs to be solved.
Design and implement scalable data and business intelligence solutions such as dashboards, reports, semantic models, extracts, and other data products that solve the business problem.
Collaborate with team members of the Enterprise Data team to identify data sources, relationships between data sources and build data pipelines that are required to solve the business requirements.
Coach and mentor other analysts on the team on best practices in data analysis and designing robust solutions.
Contribute to the overall enterprise data architecture, design, and process improvement.
Document requirements, solution design, process/data flows, data lineage and other technical specifications.
Create roadmaps for long term projects and data solutions.
Design solutions for analyzing large historical and multidimensional data.
Profile data sources using SQL and other data discovery tools in support of data quality analysis and business intelligence design efforts.
Perform other duties and responsibilities as assigned.


What Can You Expect From Us?

Our most important investment is in people. Upon eligibility, Raymond James Ltd offers flexible workstyles, a competitive compensation and benefits package. Our benefits range from Health Benefits, RRSP Matching Program, Employee Stock Purchase Plan, Paid Time Off, Volunteer Days, Discretionary Bonuses, Tuition Reimbursement and many more! We also support internal promotion and community involvement.

What Do We Expect From You?


Proficiency in understanding and creating data models, data profiling, data mapping, data mining and data segmentation techniques.
Proficiency in design and development of Power BI dashboards based on best practice design principles, data visualizations and efficient data models.
Excellent SQL skills with capability to write complex and efficient queries.
Capability to work with data from variety of sources and formats such as JSON via APIs, SQL, flat files etc.
Identify and understand issues, problems, and opportunities; analyze and compare data from different sources to identify patterns, issues and draw conclusions.
Advocate for improvements to processes, architecture, data quality, data governance, efficient design, and overall high standards in the team.
Strong verbal and written communication skills. Clearly convey information, insights, and ideas through a variety of media stakeholders in a manner that engages the audience and helps them understand and retain the message.
Collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate complex information with attention to detail and accuracy.
Make internal and external clients and their needs a primary focus of actions; understand business context, goals, develop and sustain productive client relationships.


Education and experience:


Diploma of Technology, bachelor’s degree in computer science, MIS, Business, or a related field preferred.
6+ years of experience in a business intelligence focused role leveraging Power BI, DAX and SQL.
2+ years of experience in cloud solutions such as Power BI service, Azure Synapse/Microsoft Fabric.
2+ years of experience working with API calls and JSON data to integrate with core data platforms or build dashboards/reports.
2+ years of experience in financial services industry preferably wealth management or investment banking sectors.
Demonstrated experience in using Python/R libraries for data analysis, data cleansing as well as production scale solutions.
Database/Data warehouse design and development experience is an asset.
Experience in an agile environment shipping products incrementally and iteratively.


We encourage our associates at all levels to:


Grow professionally and inspire others to do the same.
Work with and through others to achieve desired outcomes.
Make prompt, pragmatic choices and act with the client in mind.
Take ownership and hold themselves and others accountable for delivering results that matter.
Contribute to the continuous evolution of the firm.


At Raymond James – we honor, value, respect the uniqueness, experiences, and backgrounds of all of our Associates. When associates bring their best authentic self, our organization, clients and communities thrive, it is part of our part of our people-first culture. The Company is an equal opportunity employer and makes all employment decisions on the basis of merit and business needs.

Here at Raymond James we demonstrate our commitment to ensuring equal opportunities for all candidates. To request accommodations, candidates are instructed to contact Human Resources via email at recruitment@raymondjames.ca. By reaching out to this email address, candidates can communicate their specific requirements and discuss the necessary accommodations they may need to participate fully in the recruitment process.

Salary Range: BC (based on Education, Work Experience, etc) $105,000-115,000 in addition to competitive performance bonuses/incentives.

Title: Senior, Data Analyst
Company: Canada Mortgage and Housing Corporation (CMHC) Société canadienne d'hypothèques et de logement(SCHL)
Description:
Job Requisition ID: 10941

Position Status: Permanent Full Time

Position Type: Hybrid

Office Location: Ottawa (ON); Calgary (AB); Halifax (NS); Montreal (QC); Toronto (ON); Vancouver (BC)

Travel Requirement: Travel not required

Language Designation: English Essential

Language Skill Levels (Read/Write/Speak): ZZZ

Security Requirement: Reliability Status

Salary: Our salaries generally range from $ 71761.28 to $ 89701.60 and are based on qualifications and experience.

About CMHC

The work you do and the work we do together matters. We come to work every day with a common purpose: to contribute to a well-functioning housing system.

At CMHC, we hold ourselves accountable for our results and support our colleagues in their achievements. We thrive on collaboration, connecting across CMHC and involving the right people to get our work done. We have flexibility, in how, when, and where we work, within the boundaries of the business needs and the nature of your role. Our leadership style is guided by trust, where our leaders favour an adaptive approach based on the needs of their teams.

Join us and be part of a team that's committed to making a real difference and be part of something meaningful.

What’s in it for you

Benefits

We’ve got the purpose, the people and the perks you need for a fulfilling career. Here’s the comprehensive and generous benefits you get when you’re a permanent employee:


Annual paid vacation.
Annual individual performance incentive.
Defined benefit pension plan.
Comprehensive group insurance plan to support your well-being from day one.
Support towards your personal and professional growth with training, mentorship and more.
An inclusive workplace culture and environment.


About The Role

Join the Data Dissemination team in the Senior, Data Analyst position. The role involves the delivery of data services and products to both internal and external clients through effective systems analysis and design, modeling, programming and data manipulation. The ideal candidate will have strong programming and analytical skills and can also understand client needs and translate this into useful data. This is a challenging and exciting role for someone who is passionate about data and wants to make a difference in the housing sector.

What You’ll Do


Lead business-as-usual production of various data products and reports (includes production of static data tables in Excel, Power BI dashboards, and flat files for website applications such as the Housing Market Information Portal).
Perform programming and quantitative analysis services on research or policy issues by accessing internal and external data sources, integrating and reconciling data from alternate sources, analyzing and disseminating results in order to respond to client custom data requests.
Manage and complete multiple simultaneous data-related projects by recommending work schedules and delivering products as requested.
Identify where automation could create more efficient data related processes and implementing those efficiencies in end-user systems.
Introduce new - and following existing - quality assurance processes to ensure that all disseminated products contain accurate data and are of high quality.
Maintain definitions and descriptions of data produced, stored and used by the Data Division; ensure good process documentation.
Assist with Data Division technology and data transformation projects: this involves migrating large data sets from legacy systems (Mainframe, SAS datasets, Cloudera) to Azure Databricks platform as well as modernizing and automating data ingestion, processing, quality assurance and dissemination.
Assist in transforming legacy SAS code to other programming languages including Python/PySpark and R.


What You Should Have


Undergraduate degree in a quantitative discipline: computer science, statistics, applied mathematics, data analysis/science, engineering, or related quantitative field.
Minimum 3 years of relevant programming and quantitative analysis experience or an equivalent combination of education and related experience.
Intermediate/advanced Python or R programming skills, including Pandas, NumPy, tidyverse, dplyr.
Intermediate/advanced skills in SQL (complex queries, JOINs and subqueries), and Excel (for data analysis).
Advanced skills in SAS combined with substantial experience working with SAS statistical software suite to perform programming tasks.
Ability to translate business processes into business systems requirements.
Good communication and presentation skills, effective collaboration within cross-functional teams, and demonstrated interpersonal skills.
Strong customer service skills: ability to understand and translate data needs into useable and user-friendly data output/products.


It Would Be Great If You Also Had


Familiar with Azure cloud services (Databricks and Azure DevOps): currently working, or worked, on a few projects using it.
Comfortable working with Apache Spark, PySpark and/or SparkR/Sparklyr.
Project management experience acquired through being a subject matter expert on small to medium-sized technology projects.
Experience with housing or socioeconomic data analysis and/or a Master's in the outlined disciplines (minimum qualifications section) is considered an asset.


Posting closing date: Note, the competition will remain active until filled.

Our commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion 

We’re committed to employment equity and encourage women, Indigenous Peoples, persons with disabilities, veterans and persons of all races, ethnicities, religions, abilities, sexual orientations, and gender identities and expressions to apply. We also welcome applications from non-Canadians who are eligible to work in Canada.

CMHC is an inclusive workplace where diversity of thought – and of people – are recognized, valued, and considered essential to achieving our mission.

About

Learn more about our commitment to diversity and inclusion

What happens after you apply 

We know that applying for a new job can be both exciting and daunting, and we appreciate your effort. Learn more about our hiring process . If you are selected for an interview or testing, please advise us if you require an accommodation.

If you applied before and you were not successful don’t worry – we're always posting new positions, so don’t hesitate to give it another shot. We’re excited to see what you bring to the table this time around!
